results.description:
Pittsburgh's Model & Photographer MeetUp is a group for Models, Photographers, MUAs and others who would like to get together for workshops, photoshoots, portfolio work, and networking.

Monthly open shoots allow for both photographers and models to update their portfolios, hone skills, and show off changes in look or style. Our Group Shoots/Meetups are a great way to network, add to your portfolio, or just have a little creative fun.

We offer models TF* (No Charge!) portfolio building opportunities several tims a month.  TRUE portfolio building opportunity with different photographers and different props, and themes, with NO FEE other than your time to be there!

Models who show up always get quite a few usable images for their portfolios. So, it's a great way to make sure your portfolio always reflects your current "look" (hair, tan, weight, etc)

Our workshops try to teach a skill or technique, not to just be a way to shoot some models. Models have a chance to earn a little money, and photographers have a chance to learn something, try something new, or add something to their portfolio they might not have had the ability or opportunity to do. Our picnics are just a fun time :)

We have BOTH nude and non-nude events.  We DO NOT host "adult" events.   We concentrate on the artistic and creative.  NOTE:  As of June 2012 we are MOSTLY a NON-NUDE event group.

We teach the SKILLS you can use in your own photography, or modeling, to further your goals.  We do *not* teach you how to duplicate what we do, and we encourage EVERYONE to develop their own style, and to work within the parameters they are comfortable with.

You are not required to attend every event.  Models are encouraged to participate since they benefit greatly with updated images in a variety of styles in exchange for their time.  Photographers get to work with models, learn new techniques, network, and have a lot of fun.

This is one of THREE related groups.

  • Group 1: This group is the main Model/Photography group and has been around since 2002.
  • Group 2: A new Pittsburgh Figure and Fetish Photography - "Bodies as Art" group, which will host the on-going nude/figure/art workshops and events. http://meetup.com/bodyart
  • Group 3: An "invitation only" group for serious Figure/Erotic/Fetish work. http://meetup.com/eroticart

That way you can pick the levels you are comfortable with.

We suggest you join this group, first, since this group host the monthly group shoots, basic studio/lighting workshops, and is the most openly active.
results.name: Pittsburgh's Model and Photographer Meetup Group

We are a Pittsburgh Area group interested in beading, wire wrapping and jewelry making in general. There is no membership fee -- and I even try to BRIBE people to show up with beads! The more people who show up, the more we can do!

We offer the best selection and best quality beads and supplies to the Pittsburgh area at mail-order/wholesale prices.  But, you have to make an appointment, or come in during our scheduled hours.  You can follow us on Twitter -- http://twitter.com/betterbeads -- to get updates and reminders as to when we are open, and what specials are going on.

We have relocated from Squirrel Hill (2001-2013) to New Kensington (2013-?)

results.description:
Bonjour tout le monde!  The Pittsburgh French Meetup Group has been around for a while and is user-friendly.  My name is Marc Snyder & I have been running this group for the past ten years.  I am a French professor in the Pittsburgh area.  I have been involved with the French community in Pittsburgh for the past 20 years.

I started this group about 10 years ago as a way to help friends learn French.  We are starting several classes - beginner - intermediate - and advanced - for which there is a small fee to attend.

We meet most weeks at other locations in Pittsburgh for fun, conversation, & exchange of ideas. These sessions are FREE for the most part. You are encouraged to be active and to suggest events and places - I can post them on the site.

We ask that members fill out their profile so we know who you are. This helps members in getting to know each other.

Also:  you need to add a picture of yourself before I can add you to the meetup.  we don't have anonymous members here.Materials for classes/conversation groups will be made available to those who rsvp (through google drive).I run a French ebook site:  www.franceinfo.us

Marc Snyder (moi) est un ancient élève de l'École Alsacienne (Paris) - lycée près du luxembourg, et il a fait des études d'Occitan à Toulouse.  J'ai de la famille à Aix-en-Provence et des amis un peu partout!  N'hésitez-pas à me contacter si vous avez des questions.

Marc Snyder

msnyder@alumni.stanford.edu

Bienvenue au groupe!

Marc & Roula

 

About the organizers:

Marc Snyder has a PhD in French Literature & Western civilization from Stanford University.

Roula Farah is Lebanese and teaches French in the Mt Lebanon School district.
results.name: The Pittsburgh French Meetup Group

results.description:
If you write, chances are someone wants to read it. If they'd want to read it, let's make sure that when they do read it, they want to read more! That means you're going to have to accept some basic realities, the first of which is: not all writers get paid for their work.

Personally, I think that's a shame. If you're a writer, I want you to get paid! I want you to develop a reader-base so you can get your imagined realities out there for other people to enjoy!

So, what this group will be about is to help writers get their work(s) ready for publication, submission, and earn you a royalty/advance check!

(Note: screenwriting and poetry are NOT our forte!)

Will that be easy? That, my friends, is up to you. And... us!

So, bring your imagination, your work(s) of art, and an open mind and willingness to put in the effort needed to write some break-out material, and let's help get you paid and famous!
results.name: The Pittsburgh Writers Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to PSF!  If you're looking for a sense of community, or if you just want to meet some like-minded friends--people who think outside the box when it comes to life--we are your group.

One-fifth of American adults--and one-third of Americans under 30--have no religious affiliation. Secularism is growing, but freethinkers are still a minority, and it can be sobering to pursue a well-informed world view.  This group is a place for freethinkers of all kinds to discuss our viewpoints and make connections with like-minded people.  Join us for open discussions about our place in the universe and how we might create positive change in our world.

We host regular discussion groups, social events, ladies' meetups, and volunteering events--and we are part of a larger secular community in Pittsburgh that has lots of great events.

Freethought is a philosophical viewpoint that opinions should be formed on the basis of science, logic, and reason, and should not be influenced by authority, tradition, or dogma.

Secularism is the idea that people, governments, and other entities should have the right to be free from religious rule and teachings or to be neutral in regard to matters of belief.

Atheism ("a" + "theism") means a rejection of belief in the existense of a god or gods.  It can also refer to the belief that there are no deities.  Most inclusively, atheism is simply the absence of belief that deities of any kind exist. Some atheists refer to themselves as "non-theists."

Agnostics separate out belief from actual knowledge.  They think it is impossible or not currently possible to prove the existence or non-existence of any deity, creative force, or other religious belief.  Agnosticism may also refer to having a skeptical approach to such questions.

Deists believe that observation and reason suggest the existence of a higher power, but stop short of proclaiming that we know who or what is responsible for the wonders of the universe. We don't yet know, and may never know.

Humanists believe all humans have the ability and responsibility to lead ethical lives that aspire to the greater good of humanity. They are committed to diversity, equality, an open and secular society, and to protecting the integrity and sustainability of our planet's resources.

Naturalism is the viewpoint that the laws of nature, as opposed to supernatural laws, are all that operate in the universe.  Steve Irwin, Rachel Carson, Charles Darwin, and Beatrix Potter were all naturalists.

Whether or not we use these labels, we endorse the exploration of our world through science, rational thought, and evidence-based methods.  We embrace free inquiry, skepticism, and critical thinking.

People of all faiths and non-faiths are welcome to join us for conversation and philosophic exploration.  We welcome everyone!

*PSF is also affiliated with The Center for Inquiry–Pittsburgh, and with the Pittsburgh Coalition of Reason.  CFI sponsors local events to create a thriving community based on science, secularism, and Humanist values. Programming includes social events, discussion groups, and lectures designed to encourage free thought, critical thinking, and community activism. Learn more at: www.pittsburghcor.org

Please note that annual dues for Pittsburgh Secular Freethinkers are 100% voluntary.
results.name: Pittsburgh Secular Freethinkers (CFI)

results.description:
Meet other local Small Business Owners!


Come to a Small Business Meetup to:

- Network with other business owners

- Find new customers

- Get advice and avoid costly mistakes

- Hear how others have overcome hurdles and achieved success

- Member to Member Discounts


All are welcome! Our group has a wide variety of business owners. Because we are so diverse, joining the Pittsburgh Small Business Meetup will provide plenty of opportunities to network with, learn about other members and their businesses, and help each other out with business leads and information.

Guest speakers are an excellent source of information for members and a chance for the speaker to get some additional business leads. If you have a suggestion, or are willing to give a presentation on a topic that you know well, please contact me.


I'm looking forward to meeting you and learning about you and your business!

Our typical meeting agenda:

6:30 - 7:00 - Arrival and informal networking
7:00 - 7:05 - Group Announcements
7:05 - 7:30 - 1 minute commercials (introductions)
7:30 - 8:00 - Speaker Presentation (different topic each month)
8:00 - 8:15 - Q&A for Speaker
8:15 - 9:00 - Networking opportunity

results.description:
Explore Pittsburgh's Restaurants & Make New Friends! If you love trying new restaurants, making new friends, and exploring Pittsburgh; this is the Meetup for you! We're a mix of singles and couples of all ages. Everyone (21 and over) is welcome. Our events are mainly focused around food, but this is not just a dining group; we offer many diversions for your Meetup pleasure. Typical events might be:  Dinners, Happy Hours, Wine Tastings, Pub Crawls, Brunches, Hikes, Concerts, Movies n' at. *If you don't know what "N' At" means, Google "Pittsburghese." (It's just "Dining and that!")

Pittsburghese Links:
www.pittsburghese.com/
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh_English

Dining with strangers, and making new friends: When you join Dining N' At, you'll have the opportunity to dine at a variety of restaurants in the Greater Pittsburgh area! Together, we'll discover some incredible new places and delicious cuisine. It brings me great pleasure to share these places with you, the members. I invite you to come to a local dining and other related event to break bread n' at with fellow foodies and gourmets. Discover new restaurants, enjoy delicious meals, listen to live entertainment and make satisfying conversation with friendly dinner companions. This group is intended for singles and couples AGE 21 AND OVER.

Facebook Group:
www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=18155435619

Future Questions: If you ever have any questions about a specific event, please contact the event's HOST, listed in the event details under "SELECTED BY" or at the top of the RSVP list under "EVENT HOST." Click on the person's name, which is a LINK to his/her profile page. From that page, click "Send Email" to send that person your question. I am the main organizer for the group, but I can't answer questions about someone else's event. I have a wonderful team of event organizers who do a great job of planning a wide variety of dining and other events.

RSVP Etiquette:  Please honor your RSVP! Our event planners do a lot of work to organize events. Please treat the group with the same respect you would show your own family and friends. If you RSVP "YES" and later find you can't attend, please change your RSVP to "NO" ASAP. If something comes up at the last minute, please call the event planner (if he/she has given a phone number) or call the restaurant or venue. Someone there can give your message to the event planner.

FYI: It is not necessary to RSVP "No" for events you can't attend. This is ONLY needed when you change from a "Yes" RSVP to a "No" RSVP.

Wanted:  Event Planners! I am always looking for new people to become Event Organizers for Dining N' At. If you are interested in planning events, please read my guidelines here:  http://www.meetup.com/pittsburgh-dining-nat/messages/boards/thread/28322002.

After reading the guidelines, if you are still interested, please send me an email with your phone number and the best time to reach you. I will call and discuss the duties of this volunteer position, as well as answer any questions you may have. It's fun and very rewarding, but there are some responsibilities involved. (Most of it is common sense, like making reservations at restaurants, asking in advance if they will write separate checks, etc.) My email is:  dnalansky AT yahoo.com. You can also email me from my Meetup profile page.

Wanted:  Event Suggestions! If you have a great idea for a future Dining N' At event, please send me an email and share your thoughts. I'm always looking for new and interesting restaurants to dine in, and places to explore in the Pittsburgh area. You can also start a new post on the Dining N' At Message Board to solicit opinions and get feedback from our members:  http://www.meetup.com/pittsburgh-dining-nat/messages/boards/.

My Philosophy: It is my personal philosophy to avoid CHAIN RESTAURANTS like the plague, so you will not find any of my events taking place in that type of establishment. However, my assistant organizers are free to choose any location that suits them. I prefer to support small "Mom & Pop" type local businesses here in the Pittsburgh area. The food is usually better, if not outstanding! Small, one-of-a-kind restaurants offer a unique experience that can't be duplicated IMHO.

My Faves: Some new personal favorites of mine are Tin Front Cafe in Homestead near the Waterfront, Pan Alma Latin Kitchen in Regent Square, and Smiling Banana Leaf in Highland Park. I will occasionally go to a "small chain" restaurant, such as Mad Mex, or Emiliano's because they started in Pittsburgh, and still base their operations here...and their food is REALLY DELICIOUS!

Thank you for your interest in Dining N' At. Please don't hesitate to contact me with any questions, thoughts or suggestions for the group. I look forward to meeting you at future events.

Best regards,

Deena Alansky, Main Organizer
Pittsburgh Dining N' At Meetup Group
results.name: Pittsburgh Dining N' At

results.description:
If you like to spend time outdoors, then this is the group for you! We offer you the opportunity to get outside through a variety of outdoor hiking events.

Pittsburgh Hiking Meetup is run by volunteer leaders who love the outdoors and want to get people outside. We are not paid guides. We do this because we are passionate about being outdoors. We are outdoor enthusiasts like yourself.

*Each volunteer determines what kind of hike they want to post.
* Each event has different expectations, directions and details. Please take time to read the details carefully and make sure the hike you are interested in is the right one for you.
* If you have questions about a specific hike, please email the specific hike leader directly.

When a person hosts a hike, that person represents the Pittsburgh Hiking Meetup Group, and must follow the rules of the park (and enforce them to the hikers she or he is leading).  The group cannot risk being ejected from a park because of a few of its hikers.  This is also to ensure the safety of the dogs.

If you host an event, you represent the group, and with this privilege comes the responsibility of following the law.


ALL DOGS on hikes with our group must be leashed at ALL TIMES.

If you have suggestions for hikes, or general questions about hiking, please use the Message Board.

We all look forward to meeting you on the trail!

One more very important thing....
When participating in Pittsburgh Hiking Meetup events, it is assumed that all participants are responsible for their own safety and of their dependents (such as children) at the event. The facilitator is simply providing an opportunity for everyone to enjoy the event together and is not assuming responsibility or liability for the safety of the participants.
results.name: The Pittsburgh Hiking Meetup Group

results.description:
Since 2007, we have been a local social support group for Southwestern Pennsylvania Autistic and Aspergers Adults (age 18 + over) for monthly gatherings at various venues around Allegheny County. In the last 8 years we have met consistently every month in various venues in Allegheny county.

OUR GOALS
The goal of this Meetup group is to create connections and camaraderie for diagnosed Autistic and Aspergers adults age 18+ and older. By meeting for monthly gatherings and events, our members can foster friendships, develop support networks and expand their social horizons and interests.

 We have chosen not to be affiliated with any a formal organization, but publish the events, and materials associated with many different organizations that provide advocacy, research
and resources for individuals on the Autism spectrum:

Some of those organizations are:

Aboard - Pennsylvania - Based in Pittsburgh: 

Emmaus Pittsburgh

Foundation for Autism Support and Training

 Achieva

Three Rivers Center for Independent Living

United Cerebal Palsy

Easter Seals

Autism Society of America


WHO IS THIS GROUP FOR?
This support group is specifically for adults 18+ on the Autism Spectrum with a formal diagnosis.
Please note: Any new member, must provide a reference to your diagnosis by a psychologist, psychiatrist, or a behavioral health professional. Please state your official diagnosis and the facility of where it was provided.

If you are joining for a son, daughter or sibling, please state your name and the name of the person you are requesting membership for.

This support group is for Aspergers and Autistic adults over the age of 18.
results.name: SWPA Adult Autism Meetup & Social Group

results.description:
Moms@Play is now accepting applications for new members!

This is an active and supportive group for families in the Greensburg, PA and surrounding Westmoreland County area. We currently specialize in activities for children from birth-6 years, though parents with children of all ages are always welcome! We have lots to offer you and your family, from parties, to daily themed playgroups, public outings, social Moms's Only gatherings, charity events, and educational seminars. If you're looking for excitement and enrichment to build on your parenthood experience, this is the group for you!

Please refer to our "About Us' page for membership information. If you know a current member in our group, please note this in your application. For safety purposes, we require all new applicants to attend one of our public meet-ups prior to being approved for membership.

All application questions must be answered completely prior to the approval process beginning. Please scroll down to complete the application before hitting 'submit'. We also require that all of our members contribute to the group by hosting at least once every quarter. If you're looking to come out and make friends, this is the group for you! We can't wait to meet you!
results.name: Moms@Play

results.description:
Our group's primary focus is fundraising. More specifically, finding and implementing fundraising programs that provide recurring income for non profit organizations. 

We truly understand the importance of a great fundraising program. The programs we discuss are designed to create long term recurring income for your organization. We also discuss ways to get corporations to "pay" your volunteers to fund raise on your organization's behalf!
results.name: The Pittsburgh Fundraisers Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to the North Hills Board Games Meetup! We are a group of adults that get together regularly to roll dice, move counters, play cards, and generally have a fun time. I hope you can join us at our monthly meetings - bring along a favorite game, or show up and try someone else's favorite.  Feel free to suggest new Game Meetup locations, days, and time -- especially if you want to host!

In addition to playing my favorite games Scattergories and Taboo, we have shared and played many games, such as: Apples to Apples, Boggle, Card Sharks, Cranium, Die Händler, In A Pickle, Jamaica, LoudMouth, Locos, Mexican Train, Password, Puerto Rico (euro game), Quelf, Rack-O, Risk! (Star Wars Version), Santiago, Scrabble, Ticket to Ride, Ticket to Ride Europe, TriBond, Whazit, Who Wants to be a Millionaire, Wits & Wagers, and more.

Sometimes we have to split into groups to play. Other members have enjoyed playing Metropolys, The Settlers of Catan, Modern Art, Merchant of Venus, Can't Stop!, Tigress and Euphrates, and Ivanhoe.

If you bring the game, we will probably play it!

 

NEW FOR 2013:

For every game meetup that you attend that I am hosting, your name will go in for a drawing for a grand prize at the end of the year. Therefore, if you attend every game meetup I host this year -- probably just the 12 at the library -- you will have 12 chances to win the big attendance prize!

I may be having attendance prizes throughout the year ... you'll have to show up to find out!

results.description:
Welcome to the WOMENS SMALL BUSINESS ASSOCIATION (WSBA) - Pennsylvania.

WSBA is a resources for women to connect, learn practical and professional strategies from nationally and locally recognized experts, and network with peers.

Our mission: To become a valuable resource to business women, by helping and stimulating small and start up business throughout PA., through networking, opportunities, and education.

One of the most important goals of the WSBA is to foster women's economic independence by helping them develop skills needed for entrepreneurial success. WSBA believes strongly that self-employment is a viable and a needed option for all women.

Several chapters make up WSBA, and they cover 8 counties. Each chapter represents a county. Currently, we have 8 chapters. The Allegheny chapter was the 1st chapter to form, and it consists of almost 700 members. You are welcome to join our other chapters, and begin networking with business women specific to their area. Just click on the chapter link of your choice.

Westmoreland Chapter  Beaver Chapter  Butler Chapter  Washington Chapter  Fayette Chapter  

Blair Chapter  Lehigh County

This resource unites business women! You and your business will grow, because the members of WSBA want to be your support team! To review the products and services that WSBA recommends, please visit our Premier Members.

 

To get listed in our exclusive premiere member directory and/or learn about all that WSBA has to offer, please visit www.WSBA.biz.  Details on the different levels of Membership will also be available on this site.

Please note: This online community is limited to business women only. WSBA has several opportunities for business men to network with our members at any of WSBA events listed below:

- Attend the next After-work network (TM) in Pittsburgh, Beaver County, or Westmoreland. 

To find the next networking opportunity near you please click on WSBA Calendar

- Attend or participate in any of the WSBA annual events: WSBA Spring Networking Event, Women's Small Business Conference, WSBA Fall Networking Event, WSBA Community Service Luncheon.


Click on link: www.WSBA.biz

 

We thank you for joining us!

 

Susan Miller

WSBA Founder

results.description:
Donate to this group!

Transitioning away from fossil fuels to local economies should be fun, practical, and (extremely) profitable. We connect you to who's doing it that way in Pittsburgh. That means our sustainable business & grassroots scene--food, energy, super-insulative buildings, Social Entrepreneurship & more--through tours, networking, films, speakers, classes, etc. Join us & suggest a new Meetup! Or sign up for our email list, which has full event updates semi-biweekly. Or ask us stuff! Or catch us on Facebook!

Transition Initiatives try to make communities more fun and connected while preparing them for troubled times ahead. Transition Pittsburgh draws people to businesses, nonprofits, & neighborhood initiatives already doing this.

There's so much already here in PGH to see that's just a bus ride or click away: Construction Junction's salvaged building material warehouse, Stormworks' rain barrels, GTECH's vacant land reclamation, GrowPGH's urban farming, the Larimer neighborhood's bid for $30-million-plus in federal and local grants, the Environmental Finance Collaborative’s 4-organization split CFO, etc.

Our aim as a Hub for local Transition Initiatives is to have an initiative in every neighborhood & town across Pittsburgh, each making their participants lives more rewarding and fun... i.e building businesses and initiatives that're trying to relocalize their economy as much as possible--with more local food, local building materials, local energy (solar, wind)--transitioning away from fossil fuel use. We also do the practical work ourselves, if we see gaps we can fill and people who'll help fill them.

There's a global, ~450-initiative-stong network of these initiatives, in at least 34 countries, ~120 in the U.S.

About the larger picture: Reinventing Fire says the U.S. could get off coal and oil by 2050, profitably--and shows how renewables & efficiency will soon become a matter of national competitiveness if we don't. Rocky Mountain Institute worked with officials at Shell, GM, Volkswagen, and many other companies to produce the book, and Bill Clinton backs it. The Upcycle, with similar credentials, goes into how Cradle to Cradle design has changed similar companies like Ford, Walmart, USPS, and Chinese corporations.

Some notes & guidelines:

  1. Like other Meetups, RSVP "No" only if you planned on going and had to cancel. And know that the RSVP count never really accurately displays how many people actually have come since...
  2. ...We're also on Facebook & Twitter. Spread the word there. :)
  3. For questions, thoughts, requests, or questions about "how do I get further involved?" consider messaging Justin Thakar, who's one of the current organizers. There's always new ways to plug in.

 

An expanded "About Us" with further reading is here. Join in the conversations & grassroots work today! :)
results.name: Transition Pittsburgh

We are a local group of vegans, vegetarians, and friends that like to get together a couple of times a month to eat, exchange recipes and sometimes food, and otherwise talk about our lives. Most of the time we meet at restaurants or coffee shops, but we are also interested in volunteering and getting involved in the community, and coordinating vegan outreach events.

We welcome anyone to our meetings, including family and friends! We love to meet people and always enjoy good company and conversation. Vegans, vegetarians, and omnivores are welcome. We do ask that you follow a vegan diet at the meetings.

Vegan (pronounced VEE-gun): To live without exploiting animals. A vegan does not consume: meat, fowl, fish, seafood, eggs, dairy products (milk, cheese, whey, casein, butter), gelatin, honey, beeswax. Also, does not wear: leather, fur, silk, or wool. (If you are preparing a dish for a meeting and need to confirm the ingredients are vegan, please contact the Group Organizer, Michelle.)

Please check out our calendar to see if there's an event that you're interested in attending! It would be great if you could RSVP in advance so we know how many seats to reserve! We give this count to the restaurant, so they know how much food to prepare.

We also welcome any ideas for new events! Hope to see you soon!

results.description:
Welcome Non-Native Pittsburghers and returning natives!

This group was initially organized by Kellie Gormly, a Texas transplant, and was transferred to Katherine O. in March 2010, and as of May 2012, I have been asked to organize.

Pittsburgh may have a lot to offer, but it’s more fun to do it with other people.  You can be single or married, non-native or even a native who has moved away and come back to join this group. Our typical member is mid twenty-something to forty-something, with a sprinkling on either end of the age scale. Just come out and join us for some conversation and see who you meet and what you learn.

Pittsburgh is a wonderful city, however it can be very difficult to make friends. This group was started by Kellie to help women, who have not been here their whole lives, connect with other women.

To join our group, we do ask for a few basics:

1) You need a profile picture so that we can recognize you. Our organizers can sometimes find you quicker than you can find them in crowded places. Walking up to strangers and asking if they are there for a meetup gets you some funny looks (been there, done that).
2) Please answer the profile questions so people can learn about the folks they are coming out to meet. People can send messages before and after they meet you. Sometimes it’s fun to find a new member from your home country, state, or town.
3) You have to agree to not SPAM the group in any way, shape, or form.
4) We do everything possible to foster an open environment, and request that all members give everyone “consideration”.  Anyone making members feel uncomfortable will be removed from the group.
5) Our group is as good as the people and the activities. If you see someplace you'd like to try out, add it to the message board and we can make a meetup of it. If you are interested in becoming an event organizer, please let me know. We welcome additional interest in organizing events.

6) If you have not logged onto the group in approximately 6 months or longer, we will remove you from the group.  If you find this has happened, just resubmit a request to join and you can be added again.

7) We will charge yearly $5 dues to be a part of this group. Many people don't realize that the organizer pays from their own funds to keep the site going. The dues will help cover costs of the meetup website. If we wind up with a surplus we will announce an event and the group will cover some or all of the costs for all who attend.

8) Out of respect to our organizers, we do ask that you change your RSVP if you have to back out of an event. It is ideal if you can update 24 hours ahead, but if not, please contact the organizer (most will give their cell phone number to attendees, in case of changes).  We will enforce a 3 no-show rule. If you don't update your RSVP and/or don't notify the event organizer prior to an event on 3 occasions, and "no-show", I will remove you from the group.

Lastly, just get out there and join us.  Meetup face to face.  You don’t need to come to every meetup or even a majority, but I hope to see you out there at some point.  We look forward to meeting you all and making new connections!!
All the Best,
Kristen
results.name: The Non-Native Pittsburgher Women's Social Meetup

results.description:
Welcome to our social networking group for Pittsburgh socialites in or approaching their 30s. Our events offer a unique way to make new friends and meet like-minded folks in a laid-back atmosphere.

Please note our focus is on SOCIAL connections, not for professional networking or dating. If you're joining this group to advance a professional or romantic agenda, please seek membership in another group.

We schedule casual gatherings in different locations as they seem appropriate; these can include not only "happy hours" and house parties, but outdoor activities including hikes, kayaking, et cetera. 

This group is open to people of all professions, relationship statuses, races, sexual orientations, religious/philosophical beliefs, and ethnic backgrounds. All we ask is that you hold yourself to four standards of behavior: dignity, diligence, community, and responsibility.

While this group is open to people who are approaching their 30s (i.e. 25+), membership in this group (especially for vicenarians) is contingent on people acting with the maturity expected of people in their 30s (tricenarians). If you're a member who has just turned 40, don't worry; we won't exacerbate your potential mid-life crisis by kicking you out of the group. But we will encourage you to consider joining a more age-appropriate group.

You will be required to complete a brief questionnaire to introduce yourself this group (in keeping with our ethos of community) Your answers become part of your group profile and serve as your self-introduction to the group. Please answer them honestly.

Please feel free to contact myself, Kristen, or any of the assistant organizers if you have any questions.

results.description:
To join the Pittsburgh Attachment Parenting Community, you must:
*answer our five profile questions
*upload and set a picture of *YOURSELF* as your *PRIMARY* Meetup profile picture
*review the public documents on our page (About Us, Safety and Verification Policy)
*reply to the email you will receive from one of our co-organizers

Please note An organizer will email you within several days of your membership request. Your reply to this email is the final step in the membership process. Please watch for our email, and check your SPAM folders/filters as necessary. These requirements exist for the safety of your family and our families--ensuring that potential members are indeed "real parents interested in being active members of our community."

Share the journey, Build a community!

Meet other parents who practice Attachment Parenting!

Attachment Parenting focuses on forming and nurturing strong bonds between parents and their children. Attachment Parenting challenges us as parents to treat our children with kindness, respect and dignity, and to model in our interactions with them the way we'd like them to interact with others.

And while this approach sounds simple, attachment parents often find themselves alone on this parenting journey. We saw the need for a community of like-minded parents in Pittsburgh and started this group. Since its inception, Pittsburgh Attachment Parenting Meetup Group has grown and evolved. We are all happy to be sharing this journey, supporting one another, and building a community based on respect for ourselves and our children.

You can learn more about Attachment Parenting here:

Attachment Parenting International

Ask Dr. Sears: What is Attachment Parenting?
results.name: Pittsburgh Attachment Parenting Community

results.description:
Lock and Key Events are the new, interactive and FUN way to network, meet your match, make new friends....or just to have a great time! Be sure to get on our email list so we can notify you of the next party in Pittsburgh!

How It Works
Every woman gets a Lock. Every man gets a Key. Your goal is to match the right key with the right padlock. Every time you unlock you get a ticket that enters you into the drawing to win great prizes from our party sponsors. Prizes such as cold hard cash, hotel stays, dinners, tickets to popular things to do and more. After every unlock, you get another lock or key so you can get back into the fray and meet more people!

Throughout your quest of 50, 100 or even more locks/keys, you are sure to meet tons of people of the opposite sex in a fun and different way. Lock and Key Events are a great alternative to the club scene and traditional socials since the fun and unique ice-breaker format ensures you meet tons of new people!

Others have copied our events, but we are the original and only Lock and Key Events !! For more info, check out:

http://www.lockandkeyevents.com/pittsburgh
results.name: Lock and Key Singles Events- Pittsburgh PA

results.description:
Welcome!

This Coffee Shop Meet Up is a way to make new friends, enjoy conversation, laugh, and indulge in a cup of tea or coffee (or the beverage of your choice). It's a great way to meet new people without a huge time or money commitment (after all, it's just a cup of coffee or tea).

How It Works

Show up on or around the designated time and look for the host and introduce yourself to the group. Get yourself a drink (you're not required to drink coffee, we don't discriminate) and pull up a chair. Group sizes range, so you may just be meeting two people or two dozen. You're welcome to bring friends along (feel free to mention that in your RSVP) but don't worry if you're coming alone, we're not that scary.

The conversation should be light, humorous, entertaining, and mostly positive. It's a blast, try it you'll like it. :)

Be a Host

If you're interested in hosting your own event, feel free to contact me or post a suggestion in the group. I'd love to have new event organizers. Please keep in mind that suggested events must be somewhat coffee or tea related, and I reserve the right to remove events that are not.
results.name: Coffee Shop Group

results.description:
Meet New People....Drink Good Beer.

Meet other folks who love a good beer! We'll get together at area brewpubs, beer bars, and favorite watering holes, and maybe even plan some roadtrips to breweries and beer festivals in the region. Let's expand our knowledge--and taste buds! Fellow novices welcome...

"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy." - Benjamin Franklin

Cheers!
results.name: The Pittsburgh Beer Meetup

results.description:
To connect single busy professionals in the Pittsburgh area via several types of fun events. Lock and Key® Singles Events and Pre-Dating® Speed Dating events being 2 of them.

You should join if you are tired of the bar scene and are looking to meet quality people for friendship, romance, and more.

Lock and Key® Events are the new, interactive and FUN way to network, meet your match, make new friends....or just to have a great time! Be sure to get on our email list so we can notify you of the next party in Pittsburgh!

How It Works
Every woman gets a Lock. Every man gets a Key. Your goal is to match the right key with the right padlock. Every time you unlock you get a ticket that enters you into the drawing to win great prizes from our party sponsors. Prizes such as cold hard cash, hotel stays, dinners, tickets to popular things to do and more. After every unlock, you get another lock or key so you can get back into the fray and meet more people!

Throughout your quest of 50, 100 or even more locks/keys, you are sure to meet tons of people of the opposite sex in a fun and different way. Lock and Key® Events are a great alternative to the club scene and traditional socials since the fun and unique ice-breaker format ensures you meet tons of new people!

Others have copied our events, but we are the original and only Lock and Key® Events !!  

Pre-Dating® is the world's largest Speed Dating service for single professionals with monthly events in over 70 cities in the US and Canada. If you are so successful and busy that you don't have time to meet new people, don't like to date clients or co-workers and are not interested in the bar scene then try Pre-Dating speed dating events! The FUN way to Speed Date!

Pre-Dating is a fun, safe and efficient way for busy single professionals to meet in person. You'll meet other people in your age and interest group through a series of face-to-face six minute "pre-dates" in a private area at a local upscale restaurant/bar. Wow... many face-to-face "dates" in just 1 night!

 

I look forward to seeing you at a future event!

Casey
results.name: Pittsburgh Single Professionals

results.description:
Meet other people from Pittsburgh and surrounding areas interested in exploring  metaphysics. We can cover anything from self-healing, meditation, modern shamanism to the search for enlightenment.

Everyone is welcome!  This group is about exploring new possibilities, going deeper, and having fun. Come out and get together at one of our events. Hope to see you soon.
results.name: The Pittsburgh Metaphysics Meetup Group

results.description: Had enough of astrologers, psychics, homeopaths, and spirit channelers? Yearning to talk with someone rational for awhile? Meetup with other local skeptics for some refreshing and sane conversation. We host three events each month: Drinking Skeptically, Brunching Skeptically, and the Science and Skepticism Book Club.  Steel City Skeptics is part of a larger network of local secular groups, including the Pittsburgh Coalition of Reason. For more info you can check our website: www.steelcityskeptics.net
results.name: Steel City Skeptics

results.description:
Meet other people in your area interested in backpacking. Talk about locations, equipment, recipes, etc., and find people to take trips with. Experience a variety of trips planned for different levels of experience and interests. You should come along with us, if you enjoy being outdoors, want to have some adventure and enjoy meeting people and having new experiences. Backpacking in a group is an entirely different way of getting to know people!

Typical trips range from 2-3 days in all types of weather, in all seasons. There is a wide variety of terrain to be hiked in PA, NY, WV, etc. so preparation can be key to enjoying your time out and about. Individual trip organizers will choose terrain and let you know what pace they intend to keep.

If you are new to this, please ask questions.
results.name: SWPA Backpackers

results.description:
Welcome to the Pittsburgh 9.12 Project

 

  

*********************************

 

 Our Mission Statement


“Through education and service, our goal is to develop and support principled leaders and encourage our member’s active participation in a movement to restore the core values of our country’s founders.”

 

***********************************

 

Do you remember 9/11? The days before and after?

Remember 9/10? We were divided, some of us with our heads in the sand...

Remember 9/11? Some were shocked, angry, and all of us saddened...

Remember 9/12? We were united with a common purpose, there was no red state/ blue state, we were the United States standing together to protect the greatest nation ever created.

 

What is the Pittsburgh 9.12 Project?

 

Our group is founded in 2009 on 9 Principles and 12 Values that are fundamental to our Country. We're creating a community of Americans who believes that the power rests with the people, not the politicians.  Many Americans, both Republican and Democrat, understand that Washington DC is broken. Many times it seems that the political solution is the problem. No more. Our founders knew the solution is "We The People."

 

The 9 Principles


1. America Is Good.    

2. I believe in God and He is the Center of my Life.  

  •  
    • “The propitious smiles of Heaven can never be expected on a nation that disregards the eternal rules of order and right which Heaven itself has ordained.”  from George Washington’s first Inaugural address.    

3. I must always try to be a more honest person than I was yesterday.  

  •  
    • “I hope that I shall always possess firmness and virtue enough to maintain what I consider to be the most enviable of all titles, the character of an honest man.”  George Washington    

4. The family is sacred. My spouse and I are the ultimate authority, not the government.

  •  
    • “It is in the love of one’s family only that heartfelt happiness is known. By a law of our nature, we cannot be happy without the endearing connections of a family.”  Thomas Jefferson    

5. If you break the law you pay the penalty. Justice is blind and no one is above it.

  •  
    • “I deem one of the essential principles of our government… equal and exact justice to all men of whatever state or persuasion, religious or political.”  Thomas Jefferson    

6. I have a right to life, liberty and pursuit of happiness, but there is no guarantee of equal results.  

  •  
    • “Everyone has a natural right to choose that vocation in life which he thinks most likely to give him comfortable subsistence.”  Thomas Jefferson    

7. I work hard for what I have and I will share it with whom I want to. Government cannot force me to be charitable.  

  •  
    • “It is not everyone who asketh that deserveth charity; all however, are worth of the inquiry or the deserving may suffer.”  George Washington    

8. It is not un-American for me to disagree with authority or to share my personal opinion.  

  •  
    • “In a free and republican government, you cannot restrain the voice of the multitude; every man will speak as he thinks, or more properly without thinking.”  George Washington    

9. The government works for me. I do not answer to them, they answer to me.  

  •  
    • “I consider the people who constitute a society or a nation as the source of all authority in that nation.”  Thomas Jefferson


 

The 12 Values

 
* Honesty
* Reverence
* Hope
* Thrift
* Humility
* Charity
* Sincerity
* Moderation
* Hard Work
* Courage
* Personal Responsibility
* Gratitude

 

Welcome!  Please join us...
results.name: Pittsburgh 9.12 Project

results.description: To meet, network, discuss Health and Wellness, Taoist Philosophy, Alternative Medicine, and to share experiences about practicing and living the arts of Tai Chi and Qigong. The path is often times hard to follow, and the journey is long, but simply by being aware that there are others out there makes you realize that you are never alone. Share knowledge and wisdom for growth and support. Even if you have never done tai chi or qigong, or even heard of taoist, but your interested in health and wellness you should still come and share your experiences and check it out. Come and share your experiences, your knowledge(even if it is of another spiritual art), and your practice. This group is about supporting our practice by practicing together. Please RSVP for attendance. Please contact Tom Menditto, Tai Chi Teacher/Owner of The Dao Center LLC at 215-307-9855 or email: thedaocenter@yahoo.com for more information.
results.name: Tai Chi,Qigong, Health and  Wellness, and Taoism

results.description:
Meet other local aficionados and lovers of the MINI Cooper automobile! It's basically that simple. We thought that it would be great if there was some meetup group here in the 'burgh that you could meet other MINI enthusiasts, without paying a membership fee for. Yes, it would be good if you owned a MINI, but what if you wanted to live vicariously through other MINI owners... We'd be happy to throw someone else in our boot! We're open to suggestions for events! We love to do rallies, garage days, track days, social events, drive-in movies, and tons of other fun stuff. Feel free to post suggestions on the discussion board.

 

Ps. We've joined up with PittStopMINI so check out their website and feel free to join the club.  (You don't have to be a member to participate in meetup or PittStopMINI events.)
results.name: The Pittsburgh MINI Cooper Meetup Group

results.description:
Are you disgusted with the direction our Government is going?  Is this the America you have known?  Do you fear that your children and future generations will never have the opportunities that we have had?  If you agree with us, join us in a grass roots movement to stop the insane direction of this government and return our country to its Constitutional Principles.  We know that it is hard to spend the time to be politically active when you are busy working and supporting your family.  It is easy to demonstrate and be politically active when you don't have a job and your goal is to get something for nothing, or when ACORN is paying you money to show up and demonstrate. Consequently, we are at a distinct disadvantage with other political organizations.  However, we can all see where our lack of participation has gotten us.  No matter how difficult it may be, we must stand up for our belief in our country and our Constitution before it is too late.

 
We will be having our Veterans and Patriots United monthly meetings on the last Wednesday of every month at 7:00pm.  We have agreed to limit the meeting to two hours.  We are experimenting with a new location for the meetings, so please pay attention to the location when planning to attend.
Our group spent our original (9) months educating ourselves and creating our political platform to accurately describe the type of candidates we would like to support in order to bring this country back to its Constitutional roots.  Our political platform is our Group’s defining document and you can view it by clicking on the “FILES” section of this site.  Take the time to read it and understand it and you will clearly see how far our country has strayed from what the Founding Fathers had envisioned and how blatantly the Constitution has been violated.

Our future meetings will be dedicated to education and taking positive steps in order to get candidates elected that agree with our political platform.  We will listen to candidates speak and determine how best to support those candidates that we believe will most closely reflect our political platform.  Without the public’s support, we will not be successful.  Please attend our meetings and become a member.  Pass the word and make a difference.  Do it for your family, your children, and future generations.  We only ask for a committment of two hours a month to attend our monthly meetings.  Is two hours a month too much to ask in order to try your best to make a difference and get this country headed back in the right direction? Please help us!

Respectfully,

Sam DeMarco

VPU President

and

Mick Morrow

VPU Organizer and Advisor
results.name: Veterans and Patriots United

results.description: The Boston Tea Party was an act of direct protest by American Colonists demanding representation in the British Government. They became known as the original patriots. The Pittsburgh Tea Party of 2009 and Tea Parties all across America will reinvigorate that American and Patriotic spirit; one that demands respect for individual rights and property. As the bailouts spiral out of control, we are forced to fund failed banks. With foreclosures on the rise, we are made the collateral of reckless spending. And, when the bills come due, the IRS knocks on the door of “self-responsibility”. ENOUGH! America is the land of opportunity. To succeed AND to Fail. Without consequences, what is our incentive to learn? What is our incentive to produce? On July 4, 2009, those that ask nothing from the government but the protection of our inalienable right to succeed, will gather in Los Angees, Chicago, Boston, Pittsburgh and many other cities across this great nation in an historic act of direct protest. Dissent is the highest form of Patriotism. - Thomas Paine
results.name: Pittsburgh Tea Party

results.description: Do you have a squishy, flat faced, four-legged best friend? If so then you have an English Bulldog and you've come to the right place! This is The Pittsburgh English Bulldog Meetup Group and we are looking to get together and have some fun with our wiggly butt Bullies. Bulldogs are more than just wrinkles, underbites and snoring. They are comedians with big hearts that define fearlessness. We usually meet once a month and will do our best to keep all Meetup events either free or very low cost. All we ask is that every member pitch in a once yearly membership fee of just $5 (either via PayPal to mistylynn3@gmail.com or in person to Misty Pieffer) to help cover the cost of keeping The Pittsburgh English Bulldog Meetup Group going. Also, we want to send out a special invite to our cousins, the French Bulldogs. You are welcome to join the group and come to the Meetups as well. The more the merrier! And remember, a Meetup group can only be as good as the members in it. So we all need to join together and get involved. All members are encouraged to participate on the message boards, post photos of their beloved Bullies and of course attend the monthly Meetups. Please let the Organizer know if there is anything they can do to make this group a more successful one. See ya at the next Meetup!
results.name: The Pittsburgh English Bulldog Meetup Group

results.description:
This group is about widows and widowers gathering to share their stories and to socialize with others who have lost a spouse. We plan activities that both the men and woman can enjoy.  Some members have opened up their homes for game night or a holiday open house. All members are encouraged to recommend events for the group. The organizer and assistant organizer should be notified with all of the details and it will be posted on our calendar. Activities are generally  planned in areas that are centrally located. Driving outside of your area is encouraged as you will find new relationships and activities.   Membership is $10.00 a year and should be paid to the organizer yearly for upkeep of the website. Why should you join? Life is all about how you handle plan B, and we are here together to make new friends, and get out there and see what this city has to offer!!

 

I hope to see you at one of our upcoming events!

Alicia
results.name: The Pittsburgh Widows and Widowers Meetup Group

results.description: Meet fellow Wine Enthusiasts near you! Come to a local Wine Meetup to taste new wines; learn about noses and legs; and discuss great vintages and estates. Everyone's welcome, from new bouquet-sniffers to educated connoisseurs.
results.name: Grapenuts: Pittsburgh Wine Tasting Group

results.description:
Remember how proud you felt on 9-12-01, the day after 9-11-01? Strangers helping others who were in need; our country was united in purpose.

The Constitution of the United States is the foundation of our country. The 912-project is dedicated to bringing people together who share similar views about the Constitution, 9 core principles and 12 values, which we will hold true without compromise. These Principles and Values can be viewed in the "Pages" tab.
We will connect to those people for encouragement, information, and advocacy, on issues of concern and importance in our communities, our state, and our country, and with the 912 framework, and the Constitution, operating without compromise.

We must unite together, so we act as one voice on those issues of importance to us, in order to effect change in our lives and that of our posterity.
results.name: Western Westmoreland  9.12 Action Group

results.description:
This group aims to help Pittsburgh based PHP developers hone their craft, utilizing the expertise of more experienced developers to share their knowledge with both beginners and all members of the group.

Some of the initial topics we will discuss include:
* What's new in the latest version of PHP
* PHP Frameworks: Do we need them?
* What is your favorite IDE?
* and anything else related to PHP as a web development language

Feel free to bring along any code you might be having trouble with; we'll try to help out as best we can.
results.name: Pittsburgh PHP Developers Group

results.description:
Pittsburgh has a rich jazz history with so many of the great legends that grew up and honed their talents here.

And we're fortunate even today to have live jazz being performed nearly every night of the week somewhere in the Pittsburgh region.  

So let's get together to hear great music, share information, network and have fun!! Anyone can join who likes jazz.
results.name: Pittsburgh Jazz Fan  Meetup Group

results.description: This group was created because there is too much stress in our daily lives and the last thing we need is another "commitment" related to work or business. But we all still need to make a living and networking really does work SO we decided to combine a little happy hour with some healthy relaxation time. The result - an opportunity to meet other business owners, entrepreneurs and otherwise interesting people in a beautiful, private, fully-licensed and staffed Day Spa. And the best part is that you can have a massage or a facial or a manicure or pedicure at the same time. When you leave our get-togethers you will be relaxed, rejuvenated and befriended. Join us at our next event and get ready to Spaaaaaaaaaah. We usually schedule meetups after work to accommodate our busy schedules. The group and our events are open to women and men of any age. We also try to include the kids as we consider that the idea of spa should be a family affair.
results.name: Pittsburgh Spa Lovers Meet & Treat Group

results.description:
Welcome to the WOMENS SMALL BUSINESS ASSOCIATION (WSBA) - Westmoreland County!

WSBA is a resources for women to connect, learn practical and professional strategies from nationally and locally recognized experts, and network with peers.

Our mission: To become a valuable resource to business women, by helping and stimulating small and start up business throughout PA., through networking, opportunities, and education.

One of the most important goals of the WSBA is to foster women's economic independence by helping them develop skills needed for entrepreneurial success. WSBA believes strongly that self-employment is a viable and a needed option for all women.

Several chapters make up WSBA, and they cover 8 counties. Each chapter represents a county. Currently, we have 7 chapters. The Westmoreland County chapter was started a little over 1 year ago, and it is currently the second largest chapter within WSBA. You are welcome to join our other chapters, and begin networking with business women specific to their area. Just click on the chapter link of your choice.

Washington Chapter  Fayette Chapter  Blair Chapter  Beaver Chapter  Butler Chapter

Allegheny Chapter   Lehigh Chapter

This resource unites business women! You and your business will grow, because the members of WSBA want to be your support team!  

To learn all that WSBA has to offer, please visit www.WSBA.biz. To review the products and services that WSBA recommends, please visit our Premier Members. Details on Premier Membership will also be available by contacting the current Chapter Director, or visiting www.WSBA.biz

Please note: This online community is limited to business women only. WSBA has several opportunities for business men to network with our members at any of WSBA events listed below:

- Attend the next After-work network (TM) in Pittsburgh, Beaver County, or Westmoreland. 

To locate the next one, please click on link: WSBA Calendar

 

- Attend or participate in any of the WSBA annual events: WSBA Spring Networking Event, Women's Small Business Conference, WSBA Fall Networking Event, WSBA Community Service Luncheon.

Click on link: www.WSBA.biz

 

We thank you for joining us!

 

Susan Miller  - WSBA Founder
results.name: Women's Small Business Association - Westmoreland County

results.description:
This group is for people who deal with shyness, social anxiety and general anxiety in all kinds of situations. This is not a therapy group, rather just a casual place where people dealing with the same issues can get together and talk without fear of being embarrassed or judged. Some of our meetings we sit and have good conversation about anything and everything. Other meetings we go out and do something fun together.

Depression is also a large part of society these days, for a variety of reasons. Sometimes just getting out and being around other people can help relieve those feelings. We welcome anyone dealing with depression to join us at all of our meetups.

I have dealt with shyness and general anxiety for as long as I can remember. It is extremely difficult for those of us with those feelings and fears to get out and meet new people. The goal of this group is to provide anyone who is interested with that opportunity.

If this sounds like the group for you but you still might not be sure, send me an email with any questions or concerns you might have.

-Justin Orison
results.name: Pittsburgh area anxiety, shyness and depression meetup

results.description:
Pittsburgh Now is dedicated to exploring the concepts in Eckhart Tolle's books The Power of Now & A New Earth and to incorporating them into our complex everyday lives. This group is for people who are ready for peace in their lives; People on the journey of personal growth; People who are ready for fulfillment; People seeking abundance; People who understand that the time is NOW.

Discussions and events focus on sharing experiences in terms of how each one applies these principles in their life. Members are encouraged to share the wisdom of other teachers and personal insights.
results.name: Pittsburgh Now

results.description:
Our goal is to assist our members in achieving their real estate investing goals.

This is achieved by education, opportunity and information networking to our members.

To facilitate this, we make available seminars, conference, meetings, flyers, newsletters and participation in both national and state wide.

Follow Us On:
results.name: Western PA Real Estate Investors Group

results.description:
"Greetings & Salutations"; We like to welcome all colors of the rainbows, diversity of community, and all Pagan Paths. As we like to say Witches, Pagans, Heathens, & Sundry Folk. This is an open social group and a part of The Black Hat Society Network..

Unity is what we like to hear; building community is what we want. This is the place where we build community one person at a time. I believe if you hold grudges and love the drama, this is not the place for you. Simple rules to follow...

Bar none we have an awesome discussion board sharing of information. Also, we have members near & far. Occasionally we will have speakers, classes, field trips, open rituals, fundraisers, mixers, awesome picnics, just to name a few things. We also hold an annual Witches Ball & Samhain Celebration with Ritual & Spiral Dance. No one in the Pittsburgh area can hold a candle to our event. We give you top entertainment, food, beverages, and it will be held in the city of Pittsburgh. We ask for a dollar a month in dues or $12 dollars annually. Most of our events are free, or for a small offering, other than the discounted ticket for the Witches Ball if you are a member. If you like to sponsor the group, one of the organizers can help you..

We have five sites we keep up and maintain...

Of course this is the meetup site

You can find us here also...

http://www.tpbhs.com

https://twitter.com/PghBlackHats

http://www.facebook.com/home.php?#!/pages/The-Pittsburgh-Black-Hat-Society-Network/119300551432076?ref=ts

http://www.meetup.com/The-Pittsburgh-Black-Hat-Society/

http://thepghblackhatsociety.blogspot.com/

Brightest of Blessings from all the Organizers...
results.name: The Pittsburgh Black Hat Society

results.description:
Collaborate with other developers who are building or want to build cool mobile Apps.

- Get help with the apps you want to build.
- Learn tips, tricks, and best practices in native and cross platform development frameworks.
- Hear about the experience of marketing an app or app development services.
- Network and get exposure to new opportunities.

Our goal is to meet new people, and help each other imagine, design, develop, and market great mobile apps and have fun in the process.
results.name: iphone ipad Android Mobile App Developers Pittsburgh Meetup

results.description:
Hello,

My name is Donna and along with Paul and Mike, we are looking to have a group that is full of outdoor adventure. We are about hiking, biking, kayaking, camping, backpacking and trying anything else.

We do require a full-face photo of all members.  If you do not have one with your profile when you request to  become a member, your membership will be denied.

If you have any suggestions, please let us know. We are willing to try anything! If you have an outdoor area of expertise that you would like to share, consider becoming an event host. We will support you and help you with the set up and management of the event. As said before, we are looking to try new adventures as well as share ours.

Welcome to your new adventure site!

Donna
results.name: Pittsburgh Adventure Lovers (PAL) club

results.description:
You belong to Meetup and you've attended a meeting here and there.  You may also belong to LinkedIn, or Facebook, you probably are also tweeting.  But are you really getting what your want or need from those organizations?  If not, read on...

These forums are all serve a purpose, but wouldn't it be better to have an opportunity to join forces with a small group of business owners that have complementary skills and are willing and able to promote you.

This is an exclusive group of carefully selected business service providers that complement each other and are willing and able to build strong "business building" relationships with the other group members.  

Membership in this group is not taken lightly; there are business and personal requirements that are highly recommended to be eligible for membership.  In addition, this group will be limited to 8 members in the following industries.

-- Accounting Professional (CPA)
-- Lawyer / Attorney
-- QuickBooks Solution Provider
-- Marketing professional
-- Computer Services / IT Professional
-- Website Development Professional
-- Employee / Human Resource Benefits Professional
-- Management Consultant Professional

Essentially, this group will provide a network of business services that are essential to all small and mid-market businesses that do not have internal business services at their finger tips.

What we are not:  We are not a group that meets once in a while and hopes to meet someone that we can get business from.  Our efforts will go beyond that.  Our goals will be to really help the other members of the group to prosper by building strong mature relationships with one another, and by combining our marketing efforts and promoting additional services; we will strengthen our network and essentially provide a one stop shop for small and mid-market businesses.

We do not take membership lightly and to ensure that our network is top notch, there are a number of qualifications listed below.  Please read this list carefully before deciding if you should apply to be a member.  

There will be a monthly 1-2 hour meeting that all members are expected to attend.  

You should plan to host meetings (preferably at your office) so that we can get to know each other well.  If you do not have an office, alternative arrangements can be made.

You should belong to at least 1 Chamber of Commerce (we will attempt to reach out to all of the larger chambers through our marketing efforts.) and you should actively participate in at least one additional networking group of your choice.

You should be able to provide at least 5 business references

Own your own business because your ability to add referral pages to your website, provide printed marketing material, and provide complimentary workshops cannot be inhibited by a parent company or franchise.

You should be in business for at least 3 years on a full time basis.

Your educational / background should be related to the field your are working in now.

You must be willing to promote other businesses (you will know these businesses well, and will feel comfortable doing so.)

Your business should not compete in any way with another business on the list.  For example, an attorney that prepares income tax returns need not apply, because our group will provide CPA services.

You must be willing and able to add a "references" page to your website, with Bios and Photos of the group members.  You should also have a professional photo and a bio available to share with the members for posting.

You should treat all clients and referrals received through this group with respect and show integrity as you work with them.  And never degrade another business in the group.

You must be willing to provide a free "workshop", "clinic", "seminar", or other type of promotional event that will be marketed to each of the other member’s clients or contacts.  This is one way where we will be able "show our stuff" so to speak and pick up new clients by providing valuable and relevant information to potential clients.  It will take some effort to market these events; however the results will be worth it.  Think about it...You'll have 7 people that are able to reach out to 25 contacts to let them know you are offering a free clinic.  It keeps them in touch with past clients too.

You have read this far, so we know you are interested.  And you know that this is a working group, not a networking group.  There will be efforts required on your part to make this work.  If you have the time to invest in the work and the ability to take on new clients, the desire to build strong relationships with folks that are in a similar situation to your own, can see the benefits of joining forces with others to increase your profitability, then you should apply today.  

Currently, there is no fee to join; however, we may from time to time, collect modest fees for items such as printing, mailings, etc.

results.description:
We are a group of people with Celiac Disease, gluten-intolerance, or are gluten free by choice, who enjoy sharing information about Celiac Disease, eating gluten-free food, and getting to know others who are sharing our food choices. We can all relate to each other's sagas of being misdiagnosed and sick for many years and our meetups are a great time to get together and share stories and gluten-free tips. We are hoping this group will provide an opportunity for people to get together and learn about living Gluten Free while having fun.

Celiac disease is a digestive condition triggered by consumption of the protein gluten, which is found in bread, pasta, cookies, pizza crust and many other foods containing wheat, barley or rye. Oats may contain gluten as well. When a person with celiac disease eats foods containing gluten, an immune reaction occurs in the small intestine, resulting in damage to the surface of the small intestine and an inability to absorb certain nutrients from food.

Gluten intolerance means just that, a person reacts negatively when they products containing gluten.  This intolerance to gluten can have many causes but still necessitates a gluten free lifestyle.

We encourage people to join who have Celiac disease, are gluten intolerant, are gluten free by choice, or have friends or family members who are eating Gluten free. We plan to have Meetup events for our group that include: gluten-free dinners, happy hours with gluten-free beer, food and product focus groups, gluten-free cooking sprees, vendor fairs, gluten-free discounts, lectures, and much more.
results.name: Greater Pittsburgh Celiac & Gluten Free Living  Meetup Group

results.description:
This is a paid membership, mostly invitation only group.

There is a small group of us who have been working/shooting together for years, and this group is going to *try* to be the expansion of that into a more coordinate, "fetish" and "erotic art" workshop group.  WORKSHOPS.  That means learning, doing, and creating.  Not sitting around.

Fetish photography is expensive, and this is an intense group for working with the artistic concepts of fetish/art photography, and erotic/art photography.  If you are looking for or thinking this group will be about about spreads, insertions, or "adult" images, you are wrong.  Dead wrong.

Workshops will have fees to attend, to help pay for props and model expenses.  You are expected to attend a reasonable number of events which helps fund the group.  Just paying the membership fee is not enough to keep a group like this running.  If you don't understand and accept that, this is not the group for you.

Many people have tried to start and maintain photography/fetish/erotic/art groups.  The largest single point of failure is MONEY.  This is EXPENSIVE.  Photography is EXPENSIVE (even with the digital cameras making it _cheaper_ than it ever was, it is still EXPENSIVE!).  Fetish photography is even more so.  Good fetish gear for a basic shoot can cost in excess of $2000 PER MODEL!  Large, stationary props that can cost in excess of $10,000. We have run groups for almost 3 decades, and understand what it takes to start, run, and keep them running.

This is a membership group for people who understand that, and who realize that working in a group is the best way to afford this sort of hobby/art.

 

Membership and continued involvement in the group is dependent on several things.

1) Artistic vision consistent with the concepts of this group art/erotic/fetish not explicit/adult.

2) A friendly, cordial, and cooperative attitude with others and a professional respect for the models especially.

3) Activity by attending/participating on a regular basis in the workshops, events, and shoots.

4) A portfolio review.

5) Payment of membership and workshop fees.

6) You must be an active member of the http://meetup.com/models group and have attended several of the Fetish, art/figure and similar workshops.  This is our screening process.

 

Annual fee is $375 per year, and may be paid in 3 installments of $125 each, over 3 consecutive months.

Your first payment is due upon acceptance into the group.

If you understand these ideas, and agree, you may apply, or you can ask questions and be a part of the more ordinary group at http://meetup.com/models

 

MODELS: If you are a fetish model (FEMALE), and want to be a part of this group, please apply.  You pay for your membership here by working/modeling, and will even be able to make some money once your dues are paid.  The more involved you are, the more you will be able to earn, and the more props you'll have access to.  There are perks being a part of the group.

results.description:
Are yinz guys interested in going green? Or do you just have a green thumb n'at?

Are you trying to live better, eat locally, or do you want to help create a more sustainable Pittsburgh? Do you want to meet other people in the area that enjoy farmer's markets and learning about composting? Are you thinking about an organic lifestyle but feel overwhelmed by it all, and are just looking to ease into the whole thing? Well, me too!


A few friends and myself have decided to take the steps to live greener, eat "more-ganic" and have fun while doing it! We also figured that there were others out there that were just as intimidated as us to make the switch to a healthier and more eco-friendly life- so we created this group.

We are looking to meet a couple of times a month to talk about composting and buying locally as well as swapping recipes and just mingle. We are planning potlucks, nature walks, garden parties, trips to local farms, wineries and organic restaurants- as well as changing the image of GOING GREEN. We are not militant zealots that want to stop people from living, but people looking to live eco-friendly and socially responsible- with an emphasis on living in Pittsburgh (an urban society).

We are a diverse group, looking to add more diversity- vegans as well as meat lovers are welcome. We encourage discussions on "hot topics" but THIS IS NOT A DEBATE GROUP- so PLEASE leave your judgements and preaching elsewhere- there is room for everyone! We encourage people to share their viewpoints and opinions, but are not looking to convert anyone, or promote any lifestyle over another.

So whether you are looking to make a small change like trying out MEATLESS MONDAYS once a month, or going the whole way and selling your car and living in a tree, come on out and meet us!

 

Free to join, but donations fuel the events!  Give if you are able!  If not, help out in other ways - host an event, offer to carpool, and of course, goodies are always welcome!

Welcome to the WOMENS SMALL BUSINESS ASSOCIATION (WSBA) - Washington County!

WSBA is a resources for women to connect, learn practical and professional strategies from nationally and locally recognized experts, and network with peers.

Our mission: To become a valuable resource to business women, by helping and stimulating small and start up business throughout PA., through networking, opportunities, and education.

One of the most important goals of the WSBA is to foster women's economic independence by helping them develop skills needed for entrepreneurial success. WSBA believes strongly that self-employment is a viable and a needed option for all women.

Several chapters make up WSBA, and they cover 7 counties. Each chapter represents a county. Currently, we have 7 chapters. The Washington County chapter was started in May 2010, and these women have referrals for your business! You are welcome to join our other chapters, and begin networking with business women specific to their area. Just click on the chapter link of your choice.

Fayette Chapter    Beaver Chapter   Butler Chapter   Westmoreland Chapter   Blair County

Allegheny Chapter   

This resource unites business women! You and your business will grow, because the members of WSBA want to be your support team! There is no fee to join WSBA as a general membership! When you sign up under this site, you will then become a general WSBA member.

To learn all that WSBA has to offer, please visit www.WSBA.biz  To review the products and services that WSBA recommends, please visit our Premier Members. Details on Membership will also be available on this site.

Please note: This online community is limited to business women only. WSBA has several opportunities for business men to network with our members at any of WSBA events listed below:

- Attend the next After-work network (TM) in Pittsburgh, Beaver County, or Westmoreland. 

To locate the next one, please click on link: WSBA Calendar

 

- Attend or participate in any of the WSBA annual events: WSBA Mingle & Jingle, Pittsburgh Entrepreneur Conference, WSBA Holiday Expo, WSBA Master Mind Dinners.

Click on link: www.WSBA.biz

 

We thank you for joining us!

 

Susan Miller  - WSBA Founder
