topics.name: Stock Investing Using Better Investing Methodology

results.description:
Pittsburgh Chapter of BetterInvesting (www.betterinvesting.org) is a volunteer based group that helps to provide education and learning for people (individuals and groups) that want to learn about investing in stocks and mutual funds. We provide education at no or low cost and host 2 investment clubs which are open to the public.  These clubs serve as models on how an investment club should operate. Each of these model clubs meets monthly.  One club meets at Northland Library and one meets at Monroeville Library.  In addition, we also conduct at least one full day of investing education annually.

The Pittsburgh Chapter's MISSION is to educate, mentor and support individual and investment club investors and potential investors using the BetterInvesting principles. Our Chapter offers classes and special events on topics from investment basics to club accounting. BetterInvesting is a nonprofit organization that believes anyone can become a successful long-term investor following commonsense investing practices. The association and its volunteers empower investors by offering the education, resources and tools to make informed stock and mutual fund choices.Please join us to learn about investing in the stock market using fundamental analysis. We host a variety of events including educational investment classes which are open to anyone. We welcome all levels of investors.
results.name: Western PA. Stock Investing Education & Investment Clubs

results.description:
Do you fancy Cafe Racers? Might you enjoy wrenching on your vintage Brit bike? Perhaps you prefer Italian exotics or are into retro Japanese racers. Are you a fan of Rockabilly, Punk Rock, Psychobilly or good 'ole Bluegrass? How about Pin-Ups, Pints of Guinness, HP sauce on your chips? Do you like grilling'-n-chillin? How about going on a twisty road ride and then camping out with your mates? You've come to the right place!

The Steel City Rockers welcome all who share our passion. A passion, based upon the authentic roots of motorbikes and rock n' roll.

This is not a 1%er group, not an M.C., we do not have any affiliation, implied or otherwise to these types of organizations.  While Steel City Rockers respect those who live their chosen lifestyle, we are a social club, claiming zero territory and do not fly any three piece patches or any M.C. insignia. Please refer to our charter link below for more details.

Please, no cruisers, no crotch rockets. Also, your bike should be able to maintain at minimum an 80mph pace for at least 150 miles before refueling. It is highly advisable that you have several years of riding experience prior to requesting to join this meetup in addition to having successfully completed rider basic and advanced safety courses. We encourage you to read our charter. (note: after two months of inactivity, you will be removed due to lack of interest and participation, unless we know you personally).

Some participants contribute $6.00 monthly through this meetup site of which $5.05 remains after fees. The contributions are used to fund the costs of this meetup website. Whatever is left over goes towards the purchase of t-shirts and other group-based equipment for rides and events (mainly beer, charcoal and burgers). Not all participants contribute to support this meetup site. Exemptions are made to invited guests because they want to be in the loop and like to ride with us.

The Steel City Rockers group reserves the right to refuse and or revoke membership herein and can change any and all above terms at their discretion without notification. Participation in this meetup is an acknowledgement and agreement with these statements.

The Steel City Rockers DO NOT MAKE ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES ABOUT THIS WEBSITE, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.

THIS SITE IS MADE AVAILABLE TO YOU "AS IS" AND "AS AVAILABLE" AND The Steel City Rockers DO NOT WARRANT THAT ANY DEFECTS OR INACCURACIES WILL BE CORRECTED. FURTHER, The Steel City Rockers DO NOT WARRANT THAT THIS SITE OR ITS SERVER WILL BE FREE OF VIRUSES OR OTHER HARMFUL COMPONENTS.

The Steel City Rockers DO NOT WARRANT THAT THIS SITE WILL MEET YOUR NEEDS, OR THAT ACCESS WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, TIMELY, SECURE OR ERROR-FREE. The Steel City Rockers ALSO MAKES NO WARRANTY THAT THE INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM THE USE OF THIS SITE WILL BE ACCURATE OR RELIABLE, OR THAT THE QUALITY OF ANY INFORMATION OR OTHER MATERIAL OBTAINED THROUGH THIS SITE WILL MEET YOUR EXPECTATIONS.
results.name: Steel City Rockers

The MOMS Club of Allison Park/Glenshaw chapter of MOMS Club International offers a wide variety of activities such as playgroups, holiday parties, monthly socials, Moms Night Out, and community service projects. Please note, you must live in our chapter's area to participate.  Our Membership VP will let you know if you are in our area once you submit your address through our website.  If you do not live within the chapter area, we might be able to help you find the correct chapter or you can also visit the website for the international group at www.momsclub.org/join for more information.  The following areas are included in our Allison Park/Glenshaw chapter:

Quickly see who you click with and want to see again for second dates - Come speed dating!!!

results.description:
Each year, thousands of people achieve dramatic weight loss through a commitment to d​iet and exercise alone, or in combination with weight loss surgery. But for those who have found weight loss too challenging, or keeping lost weight off even more of a struggle, BodyChangers offers a way to hope and health.

Based at Magee-Womens Hospital of UPMC and a joint venture of Life After Weight Loss and Bariatric Surgery, BodyChangers creates a supportive community of like-minded individuals who want to be happy, healthy, energetic, and fit by taking better care of themselves.

We are dedicated to setting you on the track toward wellness, helping you stay there, and providing you with opportunities to have fun on your journey to a healthier lifestyle.

Sign up for BodyChangers today! Call 855-BODY-CHG (2639-244) for more information.

Membership levels can be found on the UPMC BodyChangers meetup pages tab.
results.name: UPMC Body Changers

results.description:
This Meetup hosts support groups facilitated by people with personal lived experience with various challenges. Receiving support from our peers is an evidence-based strategy to build the life of our choosing. Peers who have lived through similar experiences can provide us with hope in a way that others cannot because they've actually gone through difficulties and seen life get better, as opposed to professionals who have studied that experience in books and classrooms.

These support groups will be facilitated by peers, not professional therapists, and should not replace, but complement other therapies.

I am very interested in hosting additional support groups with different focuses (ex. general support group, anxiety support group, WRAP group, overeaters anonymous, etc.) in different areas of Pittsburgh, or on different days/times, but I am too busy to commit to facilitating more groups myself right now. If anyone is interested in facilitating a support group, I'd be happy to support you in many ways.

Please feel free to contact me through Meetup or at DBTskillsPGH@gmail.com with any questions. We look forward to meeting you and supporting each other!

Thank you all,

Jess Hirsh
results.name: Peer-Run Support Groups

topics.name: Essential Oil & Herbs in Pain Management
Physical and Emotional Balance with Essential Oil

results.description:
A meet up dedicated to improving quality of life with essential oils.

Typical Activities for Members to learn how to apply essential oils in their own lives, by attending classes and workshops learning about healthcare, cleaning products, spa products, and recipes.  While I favor a company, Guests are welcome to bring their own experiences with essential oils of any brand and will not be required to pay for anything, (unless a product like a room spray is made, where supplies will be sold at approx cost.).  Additional stories will be shared by other essential oil enthusiasts.  They will be able to experience essential oils for themselves with a wide variety and selection being available.

Our ideal members should have at least an open mind and willingness to try an alternative approach to healthcare and living.  Willing to learn and curious. 
Members should join to have fun, share experiences, and learn more about essential oils, and the different applications for them.  The aim is to have classes that open our mind, but also to share in the rewards of essential oils.
results.name: Holistic Living through Essential Oils

results.description: There’s lots of table tennis activity in Pittsburgh, and everyone is welcome to join in the fun. Whether you’re a beginning basement ping pong player or a world-class competitor, you’ll find people in Pittsburgh who play at your level. Pittsburgh-based players are among the best in the state. There are two USATT affiliated clubs in the Pittsburgh area. Both clubs welcome visitors and new players. The Pittsburgh Oakland Table Tennis Club, based in the Central Catholic High School Gym in Pittsburgh’s Oakland neighborhood, was formed in 2011. And the South Park Table Tennis Club, based in the Home Economics building in Pittsburgh’s South Park, is the oldest continually USATT affiliated club in the country.   More information including hours and prices are available at www.pittsburghtabletennis.com .
results.name: Pittsburgh Table Tennis clubs

results.description:
Welcome to the Pittsburgh Flag-Football Club!

Our goal is to create a fun, social environment for football enthusiasts or men & women just looking to stay active.

You can participate in the following:

  • 9-week leagues with scheduled opponents each week, all equipment provided, standings, and a playoff tournament
  • One-day tournaments
  • Pickup nights where players can come out each week and get in a few games without the commitment of a full league
  • College and professional watch parties, and more

Feel free to RSVP for as much football action as you'd like and if you have any questions don't hesitate to email me: pittsburgh.info@sportsmonster.net.

I'd love to hear from you!
results.name: Pittsburgh Flag Football Club

results.description:
Be Part of the Family and Come Join "SCRUG"!

The Steel City Revit Users Group (SCRUG) has set the ground rules that are set up by the “Users”. This forum is for “Users” that apply Revit in their BIM Process. Our focus is on the technical aspects in model building but not limited to. Those who use the software are encouraged to participate at our meetings sharing experiences, tips & tricks, and open discussions. Our meetings are to increase the knowledge of the software but also anything that relates to the connectivity with Revit or the BIM Process. SCRUG is not a forum for advertising. The sharing of knowledge is welcome from Owners, Contractors, End-Users, and Technical Reps. 

Meetings are held on the 3rd Thursday of the Month. Locations may vary and will be both posted on Linked-In and emailed. To get on the mailing list, please contact Jeremy Schmidt, Rich Crawford, or Jeff Light:

Robert Duffy - robert.duffy@mbakercorp.com
Jeremy Schmidt - jschmidt@allenshariff.com
Rich Crawford - rich@ae-works.com

Jeff Light - jlight@mcfarchitects.com

This is a social group in Pittsburgh area for Chinese and Chinese culture enthusiasts. Families welcomed!

I tried to find such a group in meetup but there was none so I started one.   Activities can range from hiking to dining, art galleries to cultural events, happy hours to festivals. If you have other suggestions, come join us and share the fun!

results.description: This is a group for women, ages 16 and above, who are looking for a challenging, weekly, fun night out with a great bunch of women of all ages wanting to perform and share A Cappella singing with the community.  Vocal skills and choreography are taught at weekly rehearsals as we prepare for performances, shows and competitions.  If looking for Real Women, Real Harmony, Real Fun, we invite you come visit.

results.description:
This group is for women in their 20s & 30s. I started this group in June 2013 after recently moving to Pittsburgh, I noticed that unlike other cities, there is no active age-specific women's group to make new friends. There will be a little bit for everyone---whether it's meeting up at a happy hour, going to a baseball game, or visiting a museum. We will visit monthly at a coffee shop, which is a low-key way to meet new members. This isn't a networking group; it is a place for women to find other like-minded women to go do fun things. Occasionally, we will have couple nights, where you can bring along your significant other.

Suggestions for future events are welcomed! Everyone can host their own event, which helps create a group that has a little something for everyone.

**You will be required to pay an annual $5 membership dues*
results.name: Pittsburgh Ladies: A 20s & 30s Social Group

results.description:
Too much work and not enough time to nurture the Metalhead in you? Let's get together to discover new bands, attend local gigs or even go to big venues. I created this group for people (21+) who want to share their passion for the different genres of Metal/Rock music and for whom it is sometimes difficult to find someone who does not give them the weird look when they start talking about Scandinavian Black Metal (just an example!).

Music does not have to be THE conversation topic. It is just a way to gather people who have the same interest!
results.name: Pittsburgh Metalheads \m/

results.description: Drupal Pittsburgh connects people who use Drupal in and around the Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania area. Users of all skill levels and interests are welcome and encouraged, including site builders, developers, themers, project managers, site owners, content editors, and those of us brand new to the Drupal CMS.
results.name: Drupal Pittsburgh

topics.name: Single Parents, Divorced Parents, Widowed Parents

results.description:
Being divorced or single and also a parent shouldn't mean the end of your social life. You may be raising children currently without a partner, whether by choice or not. This group is for positive men and women who are single/not partnered and raising kids. Let's get together for fun activities both for when you have your children and for when you do not. Let's go to movies, bars, restaurants, traveling, hiking and other adventures (without our kids) and to amusement parks, outdoor parks, museums and other kid-friendly venues (with our kids)! There is life after divorce or a break-up!! Members of this group are upbeat and want to live a full, social, balanced life.

We ask for a modest annual dues donation to help offset costs to run the meetup.  Jim pays $19/month to meetup.com so that the group can be run from here.

Don't be shy! Feel free to email or call any of the organizers prior to an event.  Don't feel like you have to come to any event with a friend.  Pretty much all of us didn't know one another at one time and had to make fast friends.  :)

ONCE YOU HAVE A ATTENDED A MEETUP, JOIN OUR SECRET FACEBOOK GROUP.  Because  we made it secret (to protect our kids), you have to be emailed an invitation.  Email a leadership team person and provide him or her with your email.
results.name: Pittsburgh Hip Single Parents

results.description: The Apache Cassandra Project develops a highly scalable second-generation distributed database, bringing together Dynamo's fully distributed design and Bigtable's ColumnFamily-based data model. The Pittsburgh Apache Cassandra User Group is a highly awesome meetup group, bringing together cool people distributed across Pittsburgh to talk about our favorite NoSQL implementation, Apache Cassandra.
results.name: Pittsburgh Cassandra Users

results.description: Welcome all tea lovers! Let's get together and do what we do best: drink tea, learn more about tea, meet others and have fun! We welcome all levels of tea enthusiasts whether you are new to tea or a tea professional. I am hoping to get some other Tea and Herbal business owners to be able to tell us more about the teas they offer. The purpose of Pittsburgh Tea Club is to learn about all aspects of tea, to provide and encourage tea education, and to support the growth of tea businesses in and around Pittsburgh, PA. We are also planning to connect with other Tea Clubs in the US and abroad, so when you travel you will easily find your fellow Tea Lovers! The content of our Meetups will depend on the interests of the group members so please feel free to make any suggestions that come to your mind. (Please note that this group is not affiliated with any political philosophy.)
results.name: Pittsburgh Tea Club

topics.name: Stay at Home Moms and Working Moms

results.description:
We are an organization of Catholic mothers who work to build community in the Pittsburgh area. We hope to benefit one another in the work of virtue through friendship and mutual support. Our goal is that Pittsburgh Catholic Moms facilitates growth in the love, faith, courage, and knowledge necessary for building a family culture of holiness, for the benefit of our members, their spouses, and their children, to the glory of God.

We primarily do this by planning opportunities to spend time together, such as pray-and-playdates, discussion groups, nights out,  family events, Masses, family outings, and  other local events of interest.We, as individuals and a group, commit ourselves to fidelity to the Magisterium of the Catholic Church, and strive to always conduct ourselves in a spirit of charity, humility, mutual respect and kindness befitting followers of Christ.

Members are always welcome to submit ideas and feedback; however, group decisions will be made in accord with this statement and at the discretion of the leadership team.

While most of our members are among the flock of the Diocese of Pittsburgh, we are not affiliated with the Diocese on an institutional level.
results.name: Pittsburgh Catholic Moms

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in being an active environmentalist and change maker. I started the group after reading that more and more folks out there do not believe the science and data that clearly shows that climate change is real and accelerated by the burning of fossil fuels. It occurred to me that we all have a personal journey toward acceptance of our changing world and WE CAN make a difference. Please join me in being a "changemaker." We'll get outside in beautiful environment while we discuss ways to reduce our personal carbon footprint. We will develop Green Teams who take community action in breaking through climate denial, finding ways to mitigate and adapt to our changing environment, and spread the word through outreach and education.  Please join and become an active member of this group. It will be fun and a great way to brainstorm and act on a real and important global issue.
results.name: Pittsburgh Environmentalists 12.0

results.description: The "big data" revolution is here and has become more accessible than ever. There is now an overarching need to present this data in a way that helps the user understand and interact with this information in a more efficient/concise/simple/straight-forward manner. As Edward Tufte puts it, we're "mapping multiple dimensions of information on a 2D plot [a computer screen]." The purpose of this group is to bring together people who are interested in mapping data and visualizations and the artistically talented individuals who can bring new insight into the visualization realm. No experience is needed, but we can open the discussion from more static platforms such as ggplot2 (R) to highly interactive platforms such as d3.js.

results.description:
Biophilia: Pittsburgh is the pilot chapter for a global Biophilia Network of creative minds dedicated to strengthening the bond between people and the natural world through education, discussion and action.

Click here to access materials from our past meetings.

Our Goals
 • To welcome and inspire others with the concept and principles of biophilia
 • To foster collaboration and learning between professionals from a wide variety of disciplines
 • To communicate biophilic principles in action-oriented ways to a wider audience for exponential and regional impact

 

What Is Biophilia?

The term “biophilia,” which literally means “love of life,” was coined by social psychologist Erich Fromm and popularized by biologist E.O. Wilson, who defined it as “the innately emotional affiliation of human beings to other living organisms.”

The implications of biophilia extend across a vast array of disciplines including design and engineering, nutrition, psychology, public health, education, biology and the humanities. Biophilia is expressed all over the world every day, through complex collaborations such as the design and construction of buildings and landscapes; and intimate, personal encounters including nature hikes and home gardening.

 

What Will We Do?

It all starts with good conversation! Biophilia: Pittsburgh will begin by meeting monthly at the Center for Sustainable Landscapes classroom at Phipps Conservatory and Botanical Gardens. Over delicious small-plates and light refreshments, a discipline or behavior will be identified — often by an expert guest speaker — and discussed among the participants in the interest of sharing ideas and identifying opportunities. With your direction, we hope to expand the schedule to include off-site trips to biophilic regional destinations like nature preserves, green buildings, and urban gardens, and to plan and enact initiatives in our own community to make things better for people and the planet. Join the movement!
results.name: Biophilia: Pittsburgh

results.description:
Philosophical Self-Inquiry

This group is dedicated to Philosophical Self Inquiry. We have met regularly for more than a decade. What is unique about this group is the format we use to explore this topic. This is not a discussion group. For periods of about twenty minutes per participant the group members will ask questions of one participant. These questions are used to express Genuine Interest in the person in order to help them on their path of self inquiry. This is not a therapy group. There is a rotating group leader and it is their task to ask to assure that no question is leading or having an agenda of any kind. No one is trying to solve problems for anyone else. We attend the group to support each other’s self inquiry. For many people this format is challenging and takes several meetings to learn, but it is a format that we have found to be successful and useful over the course of many years. If you are genuinely interested in the topic of Philosophical Self Inquiry, with an ultimate goal of self enlightenment please join us.
results.name: Philosophical Self-Inquiry Discussion Group

results.description:
Did you know that research shows that women are collectively less happy than we were 40 years ago? That is what Valorie Burton wrote in her book, "Happy Women Live Better." This group is for women who want to work together to commit, build, and support one another to maintain happiness and balance in their lives. We will read and use Valorie's book as a guide to discuss our "13 Happiness Triggers". As we discuss them. we will put some of our "Happiness Triggers" into action by doing activities together that can help us to learn that happiness is not a given, it is doing . 

Our Meet Up's will be once a month, there is a $6.00 monthly fee to join, and a small fee for our monthly room rental typically no more than $3.00 . Keep in mind our activities take us all over the city, not just the South Hills area which is where our meet up is based for the meetings.  There is something for every women even if she does not live in the South Hills.  We will meet for coffee, lunch, or dinner, go to theater, attend special .  events, talks, or lectures, go on hikes (with or without your dog) and even catch a movie;  and even do volunteer work as a group,  whatever time allows to maintain and support each other for that "happy balance" or just have fun, our meet is for serious minded women who want her happiness to be the focal point of her life. This meet is not for everyone, it is for like minded authentic women, who strive for "doing" and "being."  

Does this sound like a good journey for you? Than join us for a wonderful trip to a great sisterhood of women for your evolving happiness. 


Please keep in mind that this Meet-up is not a "networking" group or a place or "opportunity to market a/your business". This meet-up was organized solely  for support, encouragement and empowerment.

Here are the Guidelines:

-There is a $6.00 per month membership fee, even if you do not participate in an activity. This is to cover our monthly meet-up fee. Instructions for payment will follow after joining.  

-No soliciting or marketing of products or services permitted at our meets.  This meet is for empowerment and support for the women in our group only. We will always stay on the topics listed in Valorie’s book.  Whoever sends out endorsement e-mails to the group or comes to a meet selling or endorsing a product will be banned immediately.

-Let me know if you would like to post an activity to the board, I can do it for you. Send request via e-mail pawzpetsitting2001@yahoo.com .  I am hard to reach during the day, as I am out on the road all day.  However if it is important and you need to talk, please let me know on the message what it is you need to talk and make it semi-detailed so we can make the time to talk.  Please do not leave a message with any detail. 

-Please arrive at the meetings at least 10 minutes early, if you will be late, please text or call me @ (412) 758-7105. We will begin the meetings on time.  We will spend the first 20 minutes doing introductions and warming up for our topic. The remainder of the time will be led by the facilitator of that meeting for our Happiness Trigger discussion. 

-This meet-up is located in the South Hills of Pittsburgh, however we do activities that take place all over the the Pittsburgh Area. Should  you decide to participate in those activities outside the south hills you will need to feel comfortable driving to other areas of Pittsburgh should you decide to participate, yes, south hills folks you have to cross a bridge .  Some of our members like to car pool to activities

-If you RSVP you need to show up, our core group is getting larger and space is limited to 14 women, so do so early. Give others a chance of coming if you are not sure you are coming. This is a commitment, so if 3 no shows without notice in a given year, I will need to rethink your membership.  
There is a mandatory 5  meeting attendance per year, Again, this is a commitment if you sign up, you come, if not, give someone else a chance. I clean house every quarter asking members if they are still interested, if not, it is OK to resign, I understand life constantly changes. 

-Please let the facilitator guide the meeting and topic that is her job.  When you are sharing, be aware of the time you’re speaking, keep to topic, be articulate, and please do not interrupt while someone else is speaking.  Please do not feel you have to raise your hand, this is not a classroom, and it is a conversation, just chime in.  


and finally...I receive lots of requests to have meetings closer to the place of a member’s residence, I am fine with that, however, you will need to facilitate in doing so.  Otherwise our Meet-up meets will always be in Mt. Lebanon at the Municipal Building the Third Sunday of each month starting in April, 2015.  
Please understand that this meet is a group effort, although I founded it, it takes a team to make it work and I can’t do it myself. Your help is very much noticed and appreciated. 

Thank you, and hope to meet you soon. 

Happy  Facilitator

Colleen Amos_Mezinze

results.description:
Growing krunchy kidz is a natural moms group, if our title didn't give it away! Growing krunchy kidz is a group of Mommas and their children that spend time with one another, supporting a natural lifestyle, growing and learning from each-other.  

A BIT MORE OF WHAT WE ARE ABOUT....

Our Mommas have their own definition of "krunchy" and what works best for their family....everyone has their own passion and not everyone is the same (this is what makes our group open, honest, and unique). Some examples of "krunchy" are; focusing on attachment parenting, organics, holistic medicine, the environment, gardening, homeschooling, green living, etc...

We'd love to know more about you and what your "krunchy" is! We empower one another by sharing our daily experiences and sharing our knowledge!

WHERE DO WE MEET? 

Growing krunchy kidz meets ALL OVER Pittsburgh and ALL OVER surrounding areas. I cannot stress those two points enough! We have no boundaries and this is what makes us, us! This area provides many opportunities that go beyond your own neighborhood and we take advantage of all possible venues.

We have Mommas from North, South, East, West, and central of Pittsburgh. You have to have transportation and be comfortable with a little bit of travel time some of the time for our group. 

WHAT WE DO?

We offer a wide variety of venues and activities for all ages of krunchy kidz ALL YEAR AROUND! At this time most all of our meetups occur during the weekdays/daytime. Our calendar is put together by members of our group. Our calendar typically offers at least one meetup a week. 

Some examples of meetups are; home play/potlucks, exploring  new parks, hikes,  spray parks, festivals, farm visits, museums, and whatever else you can think up! 

We like to pack up, head out, and enjoy the entire day :)

How can you be apart of our krunchy group of Mommas?

Here's the scoop!

If you are interested in our group, that's great! You will hear from one of the Organizers  giving you the specifics of the next scheduled meetups. You will not have access to our site/members/calendar schedule until we have met you at a public meetup and approved you as a member.  ***We ask that you attend 1 meetup with the first month of requesting membership.*** We feel this is more than feasible with the frequency and variety of meetups we offer.  This allows for all of us to meet one another in a public setting and to see that it is the right fit, as well as display your overall interest. If this time passes we will deny your request  and ask that you come back when you have more time and there is more of an interest.   ***note that I have found out that some response emails have gone to spam, so please check your email. You will get a response with in a week of your request.****

At this time our group of Mommas are very active members,  and to be honest, this is the type of Momma we are looking for. This does not mean you and your child(ren) have to attend every scheduled event, but it does mean that we are seeking out Mommas and Children that want to be involved. We take growing krunchy kidz seriously and would like you to do the same! We want to implement stable relationships for ourselves as well as our children.

Membership Dues:

growing krunchy kidz has a modest membership fee and we feel that your contribution is totally worth what all this group provides. It mostly covers Meetup costs, but any extra funds returns to the group in some way :)  Dues are currently 1/2 off (5$ in person, 6$ if paid online) and will start over January 2016

results.description:
Open your heart, set your intention, and join us. SupYoga is a natural extension of the timeless practice of yoga, blending with the exhilarating feeling of Stand Up Paddleboarding (or SUP).  Offering SupYoga since 2012, we are humbled and honored by the way the Pittsburgh yoga community has embraced our program.  Whether outdoors in Mother Nature's home, or indoors in a heated pool, we strive to offer our students a new way to connect with their own practice, and each other.  Taking your traditional yoga practice from your mat to our floating studio, the unique experience of SupYoga will provide not only the benefits of a challenging class, but will improve your in-studio practice as well.

Each class is taught by one of our lovely SupYoga instructors, who have earned (at a minimum), their 200 hour yoga teaching training + possess years of knowledge and experience on the water. Each are mermaids at heart, and stand up paddlers in their spare time. The safety and comfort of our students is always our focus. We want your focus to be on yourself - as you allow the fluid movements of your experience to inspire, delight, and captivate your senses.  

Interested in trying out SUP in a non-yoga atmosphere? No problem! Our Fun First Timers class is calling your name. Check out our website for more information: http://www.northeastpaddleboard.com/

Quality of experience is always our #1 job. With glowing reviews on our Facebook page and being Pittsburgh's first SUP company, every paddler's experience is important to us. 

See you on the water...Namaste!
results.name: Pittsburgh SUPYoga (Stand Up Paddleboard)

<br> Welcome to Pittsburgh Sword Fighters<br> Pittsburgh Sword Fighters (PSF) is a unique collaboration, a blend of medieval, renaissance, and modern fencing offering something for everyone.

<br> The club is made up of three disciplines.

The first is En Garde, a top tier modern fencing program and producer of national “Class A” caliber athletes.<br> The second is Corsair, a program based in the renaissance martial arts, but encompassing all forms of armed combat. The third is the study of the Long sword. Where the members of Broken Plow rediscover the art of combat based in the Geman school of swordplay.

Our goal at Broken Plow is to share our knowledge, skill, and love of the Medieval German School of Defense. From beginner to advanced, we look forward to training with you.

results.description: A group of people who get together to critique each others' works. We are a small group, and need a few more members to get our size up to about ten. We have found that beyond ten the ability to critique and be critiqued decreases. Many of our participants have been published, and some have achieved awards for their work. We cover many genres, and have covered historical fiction, science fiction, YA fantasy, and autobiographical semi-fiction (mostly-true stories, but not written in the first person). We don't do poetry, and have zero experience with plays or screenplays. We currently have no one working on nonfiction, but we don't rule that out. Past members have done nonfiction and autobiographical family histories, for example. We are seeking to grow the group a bit. results.description:
Have you ever read about a technology, framework, or programming language and thought, "I'm going to use that for my next project!" Time passes, and you never seem to get a chance to try it out.

We've all been there. Technology is an ever-changing landscape and it seems nearly impossible to keep up with it all. It's so easy to stick with what you know, especially when you need to build quickly. And the day job isn't exactly the place to keep your personal sandbox. Well here's your excuse to finally try those exciting new technologies you keep reading about. Don't let your skills go to waste. Try New Tech. That's what this meetup is all about.

The format? We'll have a 30-minute presentation on a specific topic, followed by a set of challenges set up by the organizers to get your hands dirty and really drive the point home. Yes, you'll need to bring a laptop. If you let us know ahead of time, we'll do our best to get you one.

Interested in presenting? Send an email to present@trynewtech.com. Sometimes a little social pressure from a public commitment can be just the thing you need to pick up something new. We encourage you to take advantage of this meetup. The organizers will even help you create some engaging challenges.
results.name: Try New Tech

Meet other developers and ops engineers using Docker. Docker is an open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications. Consisting of Docker Engine, a portable, lightweight runtime and packaging tool, and Docker Hub, a cloud service for sharing applications and automating workflows, Docker enables apps to be quickly assembled from components and eliminates the friction between development, QA, and production environments. As a result, IT can ship faster and run the same app, unchanged, on laptops, data center VMs, and any cloud.

Learn more about Docker at http://www.docker.com

topics.name: The Open Web Application Security Project

results.description:
Pittsburgh Chapter of the globally recognized Open Web Application Security Project. 

The OWASP Foundation came online on December 1st 2001 it was established as a not-for-profit charitable organization in the United States on April 21, 2004 to ensure the ongoing availability and support for our work at OWASP. OWASP is an international organization and the OWASP Foundation supports OWASP efforts around the world. OWASP is an open community dedicated to enabling organizations to conceive, develop, acquire, operate, and maintain applications that can be trusted. All of the OWASP tools, documents, forums, and chapters are free and open to anyone interested in improving application security. We advocate approaching application security as a people, process, and technology problem because the most effective approaches to application security include improvements in all of these areas. We can be found at www.owasp.org. 


OWASP is a new kind of organization. Our freedom from commercial pressures allows us to provide unbiased, practical, cost-effective information about application security. OWASP is not affiliated with any technology company, although we support the informed use of commercial security technology. Similar to many open-source software projects, OWASP produces many types of materials in a collaborative, open way. The OWASP Foundation is a not-for-profit entity that ensures the project's long-term success.
results.name: OWASP Pittsburgh Chapter

For more information and to get the notes for any studies you have missed, visit the groups website. You can also find a statement of faith on this website.

This Bible Study group is for those who like to study the Bible in a group setting or one on one. If you desire to be a Christian just like the ones in the Bible, this is what this group will be focused on. We desire that, by teaching the word of God, you will be challenged to be a Christian who looks like Jesus Christ and His earliest disciples.  If that is what you desire, then this group is for you. 

The motto for our group is, "Being challenged and changed by the word of God." This is what characterizes the life of a disciple of Jesus Christ.

If you cannot make one of our local Meetups, we also try to offer at least one free online Bible study per week on Google Hangouts that we live stream on Meetup, our Google+ Page, and on YouTube. If you can't make any of these studies, I also offer free Bible studies during the week at any time which may be convenient for you. We can study with you just about any public place, including restaurants, coffee shops, shopping mall food courts, etc. We can also schedule a study online using Google Hangouts. 

If there are other times which are free for you and you would like to study, please send me (Jason) a message.

If you are interested, I also have an evangelism/apologetics website you can check out: EvangelismHelp.com. If you would like to get free evangelism training, I would be happy to sit down with you to equip you and encourage you in any way I can.

Wargames and conflict simulations played here can range from tactical to operational or strategic level, and may include elements of resource management, production, trade and diplomacy. results.description:
Great Adventure. Great Times!

Welcome to the Ohio River Trail Council Outdoor Adventure Club.

This ORTC Meetup is for outdoor lovers of ALL experience levels. Come join us and connect with other outdoor enthusiasts interested in enjoying the wonderful natural resources in the quad-state area (Ohio, Maryland, Pennsylvania, and West Virginia). 

Events include but not limited to backpacking, camping, canoeing, cycling, hiking, kayaking, skiing, and stand up. *No's to events are only needed when you have previously RSVP'd Yes. 

The group is also for advocates who would like to volunteer to help build, maintain, and/or promote the Ohio River Water Trail and the Ohio River Greenway Trail in Allegheny, Beaver and Columbiana Counties of Ohio and Pennsylvania. Volunteers with all interests and abilities are welcome! 

For additional information, please visit www.membership.OhioRiverTrail.org or follow us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/pages/OHIO-RIVER-TRAIL-COUNCIL/148074912432?ref=hl or on Twitter at twitter.com/OhioRvrTrail (@OhioRvrTrail).

You are also cordially invited to join the Ohio River Trail Council Outdoor Adventure Club - Map My Fitness Group, Map My Run Group, Map My Ride Group, Map My Walk Group, and Map My Hike Group.

http://membership.ohiorivertrail.org/index.p…/map-my-fitness

By attending an Ohio River Trail Council event or meetup, I fully understand and accept sole responsibility for my actions both during and after the event and hereby release, waive, discharge and hold harmless the ORTC, and all organizations, individuals, or their heirs involved with the event from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, and causes of action, whatsoever, arising out of or related to any loss, damage, or injury that may be sustained by the attendee while participating or traveling from said event.  A CPSC approved bicycle helmet securely fastened is required. Proper clothing to avoid hypothermia and a PFD must be worn at all times during water events. I hereby consent to the use of photographs, audio-recordings and video, which have been taken of me without compensation or royalties to me. Any registration fees are non-refundable and non-transferable.

We are a networking group that is designed to provide business referrals for other members. We have over 20 people showing at every meeting and will only take one member per profession. I can then let you know if we have your profession open. As Meetup shows many people that have inquired about us, don't assume that your profession has been taken. Our goal is to get together twice a month and exchange solid referrals. We would rather get fewer referrals than get some of the lousy ones we have gotten via the traditional networking groups. We will also be having some optional social gatherings, whether they be a happy hour type or hitting the links during the nice weather. We do not have any dues or fees associated with our membership. Ken Gress
Allstate Agency Owner

This is a mixed terrain ride including paved street, loose gravel, and technical mountain bike single track sections in the woods. We will ride on the streets until we reach Schenley Park. Once in the park we will ride along the main gravel trail, exploring the shorter single track sections until we arrive at Panther Hollow Pond. The ride leaves the store every Saturday morning, 9:00 am and is a “No Rider Left Behind” ride, however the planned route does contain physically demanding terrain and features . Come out and join our ride leaders, for some fun outdoors. Bring a helmet, water bottle, spare tube, positive attitude :)

results.description: I'd like to find all of the Adventure riders in the area. My idea of great ride would be riding the paved roads out of town to the mountains, finding some cool dirt roads or wide trails, and finding a place to camp out for the night. My days of trail blazing and jumping are over I think. The adventure bikes are just too heavy to try and imitate a dirt bike. I prefer quality miles and not just quantity. I don't like just humming along in a straight line, even on a country road, so I try to keep this to a minimum. But, where i live, you have to drive at least 50 miles to find some decent roads without traffic. My pace is quick on the street and slow off road. I like to keep a day's ride under 250 miles. I prefer overnight trips to day trips, so collect some gear and storage on your bike. Nothing fancy, a good duffle bag strapped to the luggage rack or back seat is good. I still prefer the street, so my rides will most likely be 80 20. Maybe in the near future some other organizers with put together rides for you dual-sport guys.

results.description:
Many people use Computer Aided Design, CAD, software for product design and various forms of manufacture, specifically using AutoCAD, the industry standard CAD package.  Over time, AutoCAD has been extended to provide 3D Modeling capability, but this functionality is limited because the software was originally developed to be an extension of 2D drafting.

Starting from the ground up, the makers of AutoCAD have developed AutoDesk Inventor, a 3D modeling software package specifically designed to meet the needs of 3D Computer Aided Manufacture, or CAM.  The basis of Inventor is that it uses parametric modeling, a powerful design innovation that allows parts to defined by their dimensions instead of dimensioned after the design process is complete.  The use of parametric modeling in AutoDesk Inventor is similar to another software package, Solidworks.

However, the challenge of using a tool as powerful as AutoDesk Inventor is that because it uses a new design paradigm, it can be challenging to learn.  To facilitate training in the many features of Inventor, representatives from AutoDesk and members of TechShop have started this Meetup here in Pittsburgh PA.  Our goal is to bring together members of the design community to form a study group to learn this powerful software.

The structure of the study group is to work through an Inventor training manual covering one topic per week as described in the syllabus.  For members of this group, portions of the study guide will be posted in advance of each meeting.  There will be no fixed lecturer, instead members of the group are encouraged to sign up to speak on the weekly topic, and every member is encouraged to share their expertise.  We will meet in the computer classroom at TechShop at Bakery Square, one of the premier makerspaces nationally, now with nine locations across the country.

We look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Pittsburgh AutoDesk Inventor & CAD/CAM, study group

This is a group for Singles, Widowed and Divorced people who are interested in meeting once a month to meet new friends or maybe find a new love interest. The group will be holding different activities such as: Brunches, Lunches, Dinners, Happy Hours, Movies, Live Bands , Karaoke, Casino trips, Spa Events, Medium Readings, Meet and Greets and Speed Friending Events.   The Meet Up for the meals will always be held for 8-10 people.  There are a few reasons for that: 1.  Most People prefer a smaller group for meals so they can actually spend time talking to everyone in the group and it is more personal.  There have been many complaints from the Meet Ups that have large groups for the meals because they said that they never even got to talk to anyone and only met the people sitting next to them and have considered it to be very impersonal.  I prefer to keep it at  a smaller group for that very reason.   2.  A lot of restaurants are not in favor of handling a group that is very large for these events.  However, there will always be events that will allow Open House/Open Membership to EVERYONE or there will be events where there will be 20 or 30 members or maybe just 8 or 10.  Please remember you can always sign up for the "want a spot" and keep checking for any cancellations.  You are always welcome!  The group will ALWAYS be held in the Aspinwall/Fox Chapel area ONLY.   This group is a great bunch of people who enjoy having FUN and who enjoy meeting new people.  Remember....that is what it is all about.   I'm really looking forward to meeting you : ) 

                                                                                            Jan

results.description:
Reality Computing is a high-level concept in computing technology that integrates the digital and physical worlds. In Reality Computing, many different products and technologies are brought together in order to Capture, Create, and Deliver data and objects. Reality Computing technologies allow users to digitally capture the existing conditions of objects and locations (laser scanning, photogrammetry, depth cameras), compute and analyze that captured data in design software, and then realize, or create, the result back either physically (3D printing, digital manipulation) or visually (augmented reality, projection techniques). 

This group is for anyone interested in innovative technology that is changing the future. We will be having Meetup events during which representatives from successful Reality Computing companies will be speaking. Hope to see you around, and meanwhile if you want to know more check out http://realitycomputing.typepad.com.
results.name: Reality Computing Pittsburgh

results.description:
If you are interested in improving your life AND having a greater positive impact on the world, Group Genie may be for you!  At our meeting, you can: get support for your personal goals, build skills, do networking, and celebrate progress and life appreciations. You also can help our creativity team to develop new and powerful methods to help humanity.  Some people help through special skills they have (for instance, graphic design or acting in a video) but most people can help by testing out and using some of the powerful tools already created or in development.

Tim Cimino, the founder, has invented a wide range of materials.  Many are self-help and skill-building materials; but others help people do more good; become political empowered (nonpartisan); or develop a more world-sustaining lifestyle.

A big theme that we encourage people to reflect on is the question, "What is the best, most loving use of my time and life?"  Tim's answer to that question is to create powerful new methods that can be used around the world.  Other people can help his work, and can often improve their lives and help others -- all at the same time!

Much more information and many materials can be found at GroupGenie.Org.

Here's Tim describing the meet-up format (4:04)


http://youtu.be/hJ9UvInxSM0

results.description:
This is a group for people interested in Christian Apologetics.

Please see our new website. http://ukranians2.wix.com/pgh-apologetics-c...

What is Apologetics you may ask?

Apologetics: “That aspect of Christian theology which seeks to set out and demonstrate the credibility and plausibility of the Christian Faith” (Alister McGrath in The J.I. Packer Collection).

Apologetics is about analyzing and defending what Christians believe, why they believe it, and asking whether or not Christianity is true and makes logical sense. Its okay to ask the tough questions, all is fair game.

Every evangelist should be an apologist. The evangelist shares the gospel with people, and the apologist tries to convince people that the gospel is true and real.

Apologetics is as old as the Bible and ancient Greek philosophers. The word itself was made famous in the book of  1 Peter. "But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an apologia to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear" 

Apologetics is about taking an honest look at Christianity and asking, "Is this stuff real?", "Did Jesus really exist?", "Is there any historic, logical, philosophic, and scientific merit to Christianity?" Its Christianity for the deep and thinking person. Its Christianity for the skeptic and agnostic. In the end, the skeptic may, or may not, become a believer, that is their choice. But at least the facts are clearly analyzed and presented.

Take a look at this 2 minute video for an excellent explanation.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RAFlmuiA-eE


What will this meetup group do and accomplish?

This group is for discussion and debate about religion and Christianity, and also a book club for apologetics authors such as: Ravi Zacharias, JP Moreland, Alister McGrath, John Lennox, Os Guinness, William Lane Craig, Phil Fernandez, CS Lewis, and anyone from the Veritas forum, or any other apologetics author/speaker people are interested in.

Books by skeptics and atheists will also be read in order to give an honest analysis to their claims and to compare to the claims of apologists.

We will also try and attend debates and Q/A forums at Universities all over the country. Sadly most of these are not in Pittsburgh. Watch this video for an example of such a Q/A session. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M8XSa79sU0M

Basically we watch a difficult video or read a difficult book that challenges Christianity, and we try our best to refute it using apologetics books and materials, logic, common sense, and most importantly the Bible. We talk, a lot. Its mostly about discussion. If you want to listen, thats fine too.

Who should join this group?

If you are interested in the Historic Jesus and Historic Christianity, philosophy, religion in general, or you are a Christian who is either struggling with their faith, or is strong in their faith but wants a deep and serious philosophic discussion about Christianity. Also if you are a believer in another religion or faith, or agnostic, or atheist, and would like to discuss Christianity or religion in general. 

Christians, people of non-Christian faiths, skeptics, and atheists are all welcome!!!

So what makes me qualified to run this group?

This type of discussion is usually done at the University level in Philosophy courses. I do not claim to be an expert in the area of Apologetics, my field of study is in Science and Engineering actually. In fact I'm just a guy in my late 20's working for a tech company, not a University professor.

But I have been a fan of apologetics authors, and have been listening to debates between Theists and Non-Theists and people of different faiths for years now. Its something which helps me a lot in my own faith. I'm a student of apologetics and Christianity like everyone else in the group.

In fact our group currently consists of a few University Philosophy professors and pastors that have a lot more knowledge and experience than I do. The biggest thing I contribute is passion and enthusiasm for the subject of apologetics and the willingness to learn from others. I am always open to advice and everything in this group is 100% democratic. Everything we do is a group effort, and everyone has a say in everything.

When and where do we meet?

We meet in the Panera Bread community room. The actual Panera Bread may change between meetings, depending on community room availability. As of right now, we either meet in the Oakland Panera Bread or in the Shadyside Panera Bread.

We meet every 2 weeks. 2 meetings every month. The meetings are 2 hours long and usually on Saturday at 2pm. We usually have some assignment to complete before each meeting, such as watch a video, read part of a book, read an article, etc. During the meetings we discuss the assignment, watch videos, have formal debates between theists and atheists, and just talk about the subject of the assignment.

Thank you for your time.

-Gene: Servant of Jesus Christ, Amateur Apologist,Bookworm, Nerd, Scientist, Engineer.

If you have any questions, please contact me at ysoroka86@gmail.com
results.name: Pittsburgh Christian Apologetics Group

results.description:
Members of this group believe in the non-aggression principle.

From Wikipedia: "The non-aggression principle (NAP)—also called the non-aggression axiom, the zero aggression principle (ZAP), the anti-coercion principle, or the non-initiation of force principle—is a moral stance which asserts that aggression is inherently illegitimate. NAP and property rights are closely linked, since what aggression is depends on what a person's rights are. Aggression, for the purposes of NAP, is defined as the initiation or threatening of violence against a person or legitimately owned property of another. Specifically, any unsolicited actions of others that physically affect an individual’s property or person, no matter if the result of those actions is damaging, beneficial, or neutral to the owner, are considered violent or aggressive when they are against the owner's free will and interfere with his right to self-determination and the principle of self-ownership.

Supporters of the NAP often appeal to it in order to argue for the immorality of theft, vandalism, assault, and fraud. In contrast to nonviolence, the non-aggression principle does not preclude violence used in self-defense or defense of others. Many supporters argue that NAP opposes such policies as victimless crime laws, coercive taxation, and military drafts. NAP is the foundation of libertarian philosophy."


Government agents should not be above this moral law. Join us for some good food, drinks, and conversation. Bring a friend (or three!)

results.description: Sunday Assembly is “a godless congregation that celebrates life”. We are a group of generally non-religious people that get together and listen to a talk, sing some fun pop songs, and eat tea and cake. That’s pretty much it. You can call it “atheist church”, “humanist church”, “secular community”—the labels are not as important is the intention, which is to help each other “live better, help often, and wonder more”. The monthly assembly is our flagship event for celebrating together and nurturing a wider secular community. The idea started in London in January of last year with Sanderson Jones and Pippa Evans, two stand-up comedians that decided they wanted the best parts of church/synagogue/mosque/faith-community “without the god bit”. They put the idea out to their community and got such an overwhelmingly positive response that the thing went a little bit viral, with 30 assemblies popping up worldwide practically overnight. Since then the thing has gone way viral, with about 80 new assemblies working to launch in September. “Well doesn’t my city already have a dozen secular groups and a few Unitarian churches?” I hear you asking yourselves? Yes, and thank goodness for that. We love these groups. We are not in competition with traditional secular organizations but instead hope to complement, energize and enliven them. The intellectual and cerebral aspect of our average secular groups is very important and indispensable, but it doesn’t often leverage the positive power of emotion, music and poetry, or just enjoying ourselves as a group. Also, the assembly format is very accessible to families with children and seems to attract a variety of ages. Come check us out!
results.name: Sunday Assembly Pittsburgh

results.description:
Welcome to our meet-up group for those with fibromyalgia and autoimmune diseases. This group is for anyone interested in talking about things that have helped and hurt their conditions. 

 Disclaimer: The people in this group are not necessarily medical professionals. Never add or eliminate medication or other treatments without first consulting your doctor or prescribing medical professional.


1. The goal of this group is not to sit in a circle in the basement of a local church drinking stale coffee holding a pity party for everyone! We are not less of a human being because nature decided to play a cruel joke on us. This group is here to provide us an opportunity to socialize with others who understand us. We have monthly(ish) Skype meetings and in-person meetings. There will also be opportunities to walk in local fundraising walk/5k and educational meetings.

2. The exercise meetings are not hosted by anyone in particular. They are there to give people the opportunity to exercise with someone else who has similar health issues. If you want to go, sign up even if no one else says they are going. Sometimes it takes one person to start the trend. 

3. I LOVE getting new ideas and suggestions! Please do not hesitate to contact me. The only way I can schedule activities people want to do is if I know what those activities are and when is a good time to schedule them.

4. Meetup.com charges $15/month for use of their website. At some point you may be asked to participate in a fundraiser to help raise funds to pay for the monthly fees.

Keep in mind that you will get out of this as much as you put into it. I hope you find it beneficial!

<3 Jessi, with a big nod to the author, Amy ;-)

results.description:
S E X - P OS I T I V E  P R O J E C T  -  S E X  G E E K - WHO ARE WE?

We are " sex geeks " or " nerds sex ": We love all subjects related to sensations , pleasures and lifestyle! We are curious and believe that sex should be treated as something unique and essential for a healthy and happy life. We contribute for the Sensorella project  (pleasure w/o guilt). If your are interested in sharing experiences and knowledge in favor of female sexual freedom please join us! The Project purpose is to encourage knowledge of your own body and talk about sexual disfunctions (female).

* This group is open to all women and few men (only ones that works/ write about the subject / health care).

OUR TEAM AND OUR BLOG - WWW.BLOG.SENSORELLA.COM.BR  

Our team has also health professionals (gynecologist, physiotherapist, sex therapists, psychologists, psychiatrists) and with support some social projects focused on women's health, where sexual dysfunctions are treated. The most majority of our content generated on discussions is in our blog  - another part of the content that talks about health/disfunctions and comes from a project that we work in partnership, it is a very special project called Aphrodite Project (from the Escola Paulista de Medicina/Paulista School of Medicine) in São Paulo. The project gives free medical care women who have sexual dysfunctions.

WHERE ARE THE SEX GEEKS - SENSORELLA? 

Some of them in Brazil - mainly in the cities of São Paulo and Rio. And now we are also in the USA in Pittsburgh - PA. 

HOW TO PARTICIPATE? 

There are some ways to get involved ... 

 • Our Blog / content (if you like to write and share information about sexuality, send a email to us info@sensorella.com) 

http://blog.sensorella.com.br 

• Group on Facebook: private group *for women only called "CONFRARIA Sensorella" (share information about sexuality/ disfunctions)

https://www.facebook.com/groups/546766762123568/ 

• Sex Geek Sensorella on Meetup

http://www.meetup.com/sexgeek 

• Meetings / events/ lectures: Some events are scheduled in Facebook and now we will use Meetup. 

Any questions or suggestions? Contact: info@sensorella.com

----------------------------------------- <br>

S E X - P OS I T I V E  P R O J E C T  -  SEX  GEEK - QUEM SOMOS NÓS?

Somos "sex geeks" ou "sex nerds": adoramos os assuntos relacionados às sensações, prazeres e estilos de vida! Somos curiosas e acreditamos que o sexo deve ser tratado como algo natural e essencial para uma vida saudável e feliz. Fazemos parte de um projeto chamado "Sensorella", que reúne pessoas interessadas em dividir experiências e conhecimentos em prol da liberdade e da consciência sexual feminina. O objetivo do projeto é incentivar o auto conhecimento corporal e sensorial: um mundo com pessoas que conheçam melhor seus corpos, aptos a se proporcionar e propiciar prazer para outras pessoas. Sem neuras. Sem culpa. Saiba mais sobre nós e não deixe de participar! 

* Grupo é aberto para todas as mulheres e apenas alguns homens (que trabalham ou escrevem sobre sexualidade, assistência médica/ saúde).

TIME COMPLETO  E CONTEÚDO GERADO - WWW.BLOG.SENSORELLA.COM.BR

Nosso time conta também com profissionais da área da saúde (ginecologista, fisioterapista, terapeutas sexuais, psicólogos, psiquiatras) e ainda com apoio de alguns projetos sociais voltados para saúde feminina, onde são tratadas disfunções sexuais. Grande parte do nosso conteúdo gerado no blog vem através de discussões que surgem em nosso grupo de "SEX GEEKS" e outra parte do conteúdo de saúde vem dos projetos que trabalhamos em parceria, como é o caso de um projeto bastante especial chamado Projeto Afrodite (da Escola Paulista de Medicina) em São Paulo, que atende gratuitamente mulheres como disfunçoes sexuais.

ONDE ESTÃO OS SEX GEEKS - SENSORELLA?

Boa parte do grupo está no Brasil, principalmente nas cidades de São Paulo e Rio de Janeiro. 

E agora também estamos nos EUA na cidade Pittsburgh - PA.

COMO PARTICIPAR?

Existem algumas formas de participar...

• Nosso Blog / conteúdo: para os geeks que gostam de escrever e colaborar mandem seus textos e façam parte do nosso grupo de bloggers!

http://blog.sensorella.com.br

• Grupo fechado no Facebook: Grupo fechado só para mulheres "Confraria Sensorella' - https://www.facebook.com/groups/546766762123568/

• Sex Geek no Meetup: Sex geeks Sensorella 

http://www.meetup.com/sexgeek

• Encontros/ eventos/ palestras: Nossos eventos acontecem e são agendados no Facebook e agora no Meetup.

Ficou com alguma dúvida ou quer mandar uma sugestão?

Fale conosco: info@sensorella.com

results.description: This group will be meeting once a month at the Fox Chapel Waterworks Mall at Panera. This group is for anyone who has suffered a loss and is grieving.  We will be meeting in the Conference Room so we will have privacy and the opportunity to share. This could be due to a recent loss or a loss from many years ago and you may have pain that has resurfaced for any reason. Please note that I am not a grief counselor but what I do know is that I have lost 13 family members in 13 years and 2 of them were children. I lost 15 friends in 10 years. I lost them due to illness, accidents and suicide. My heart has been repeatedly broken but I do know that the heart can and will heal and I believe that we can do this together. I have attended several grief support groups over the years and I can tell you that by telling your story and helping others....you also, will begin to heal. I believe that it is a great help and part of the healing process to just sit back, talk, listen, share and be a part of a group that "just gets it." Coping skills is another great topic of discussion. Believe me...it really does and will help you to talk to others that "have walked that road." We are all in this together as one.  I would also like this to be an opportunity for you to grab something to eat or a coffee.  I just wanted to let you know that you will have time to do that if you would like to purchase something.   I look forward to meeting you.      Jan

results.description:
Welcome to the Pittsburgh Collaborative Writers Meetup

As is said in varying ways, the tools of communication change, but the ideas remain the same.  In this day, we have access to a writing tool unlike those available in the past: Google Docs.  This technology gives us new options for authorship, although in many ways the craft of writing has not changed.

Google Docs is a free online tool that allows two or more people to edit the same document at the time and see the changes that the other person is making as they are being made.  Having this functionality allows for an immediacy of collaboration between writers in different locations in a way that could not have happened in the past.  As the word processor improved the craft of writing by making revisions easier, the question now is, how does this new tool change the way we communicate using the written word.

This is a group for writers of all styles and all experience levels.  I have been a professional technical writer for more than ten years, serving as a journalist, writing content for the web, writing computer manuals, and writing fiction for my own amusement.  I look forward to using the tools of collaboration to help others:

*  Learn to be more creative
*  Overcome writers' block
*  And to write more effectively

During the Meetup we will write together, read what we have written, and collaboratively edit each other’s writing.  The goal of this group will be to improve our communication with each other and with our intended audiences.  As I would hope for other members of the group, I aspire to being accepting of all recommendations about my writing as I strive to produce the best product that I can.

Each participant will need a laptop or tablet for every Meetup.  You will also need a free Google email address if you do not already have one.

We look forward to seeing you there.

We are a grassroots, volunteer-driven organization, connecting mothers via a network of both virtual and local communities throughout the United States.

In Mothers & More, we are committed to creating a place for mothers to feel a part of a larger community of women who are experiencing the challenges that all mothers face, not only in raising children but also in fulfilling their sense of self and self-worth. We believe this begins with a sense of belonging, a space where women feel safe among friends, where they are able to utilize their gifts and celebrate their uniqueness; where they can truly be themselves.

Chapter 164 is based in the South Hills area of Pittsburgh, PA. Each month we come together for a whole bunch of different activities — from events focused on our children and families, such as playgroups and Mom & Tot outings, to Mom-only activities that let us have some time away, such as programmed Chapter Meetings and Moms’ Night Out. Our members generally reside in and around the South Hills, but we have members from across the entire metro area.

Come check us out!  A great place to start would be our Monthly Chapter Meeting:  you'll notice that we hold them on the first Monday of the month.  Or, check our calendar and RSVP to a Play date or Outing!  Prospective members may attend up to two meetings or outings before required to join at the national level.  

For more information, please visit our website http://mothersandmorepgh.wordpress.com/ or email us at southhillspghmom@yahoo.com.  We'd love to hear from you!

results.description:
Whether you're in need of healing, have been called to be a healer or are interested in whole health and well being, this group is for you! We study and put into practice healing methods for mind, body & spirit.

Together we screen videos and have open discussions and demonstrations. Topics covered are disease prevention and healing through nutrition, renewal of the mind, prayer, meditative prayer, hands on healing, our identity and authority, love, forgiveness, Heaven on Earth, sustainable Earth, and supernatural living through the nine gifts of the spirit. 

Finally, we will turn head knowledge into heart knowledge by putting what we learn into practice.

Come as you are! Early or late, whoever you are, whatever you know, just come! The world needs you to get this! If we wait for the conditions to be perfect, we'll never get started.

We rent a space at St Brendan's Episcopal Church in Sewickley. Thank you for Chipping In for our meetings here

results.description: The WESTMORELAND ENTREPRENEURS is a business networking group which is limited to one person per profession.  It was created by a core group of business professionals who were excellent at their professions, had integrity and a strong sense of community who wanted to meet other professionals who had the same excellence and integrity.  This core group of individuals was tired of spending too much time attending networking functions which turned out to be simply social functions which produced little to no leads or referrals.  They were also tired of spending hard earned capital to a networking machine that cranked out rules and regulations instead of goodwill and bonding between members.  What they created was a recipe for creating success.  With a little structure, a cup of relaxation and a pinch of fun, WESTMORELAND ENTREPRENEURS has become a terrific group of professionals dedicated to finding referrals for their fellow members and helping one another be as successful as they can be at their professions.

We foster community, discussion, beer sampling, beer suggestions and socializing, as well as hopefully hosting educational events throughout the year. Have an idea for an event? Send your suggestion along! Have more ideas you'd like to share? We need your helpful suggestion to grow and become more user friendly. *Dogma-free and possibly a bit tipsy, since 2014.

results.description:
Many historians and others consider World War I to be the most significant event of the 20th century. Its influence continues to echo through modern life and culture.

I have always been fascinated by the Great War and its aftermath. I am not an academic or historian, but an amateur scholar who would like to learn more about the events and outcomes of the war. As the world observes the centenary of the war, this is a good time to find others with similar interests.

The structure of this group will be determined somewhat by the members.  I see this primarily as a study/discussion group, but we can expand to other activities (more on that below).   To get started, we'll have a reading/viewing list of books, websites, and films to get us all at the same starting point.  Then we can explore more areas - perhaps the flu pandemic, the Christmas Truce, portrayals in popular culture (WWI in Doctor Who, anyone?), etc.

"Other activities" could include watching a film or documentary as a group, having a WWI-era dinner, listening to/performing the poetry and music inspired by the war, sharing personal family histories, and so on.  A major project I am planning is a staged multidisciplinary performance featuring historical narrative, readings from letters home, period music and poetry.  Participation in this project is welcome.

This will be not just a military history, but an exploration of the war's social, cultural, and artistic heritage. Meeting times, locations, and frequency are all TBD. East End/east suburb locations are my preference, but other areas can be considered based on where people live and work.

People at all levels of interest are encouraged to join - from novices to professional historians.
results.name: Remembering the First World War

results.description:
This is a group that is committed to pursuing spiritual growth in the context of caring, loving, and authentic relationships. All are welcome to attend regardless of your religious beliefs or level of Bible knowledge. We meet in a home in Brentwood for a meal, fellowship, Bible discussion, and prayer.

Our group has a God-sized vision: We want to be used by God to facilitate a spiritual awakening in Pittsburgh. 

Of course, such an awakening is ultimately a work of God. He's the only One who's able to awaken people from their slumber and enable them to see the truth about spiritual matters. 

Furthermore, God primarily does this as people hear the gospel proclaimed.

We believe that the gospel isn't just the "ABC's" of Christianity but rather the "A through Z." It's not just one class we take among many other classes. Instead, it pervades the entire curriculum. 

Therefore, our vision is to see the gospel transform our city. This begins with experiencing progressively greater gospel transformation in our own lives and then seeing that spread to people around us until the entire city is renewed by the gospel. 

What exactly does that look like? It looks like broken relationships being reconciled, poverty being alleviated, people experiencing freedom from the destructive impulses that dominate their lives, and--most of all--people being forgiven for their sins and made right with God. 

In other words, we believe that the gospel is the solution for all the problems our city faces.

Now, it's great to talk about the gospel transforming our city, but we also have to think about how that's going to happen. Of course, as we discussed above, it will ultimately happen by God's power, as the Holy Spirit uses gospel proclamation to awaken those who are spiritually asleep. 

However, the entire church also has a vital role in all of this. Our role is to be the "city on a hill" that Jesus talked about in Mathew 5:14. And a central component of being a "city on a hill" is living in caring, authentic, and committed community with each other. Basically, showing people what true love looks like.

That's the most powerful and persuasive testimony for the truth of the gospel--Christians living out the gospel in community with each other.

Will you join us?

For more information, please visit http://www.gracelifepittsburgh.com/community-bible-study
results.name: South Hills Bible Study

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in the inexhaustible wisdom of Tao Te Ching. Ancient Chinese spiritual-philosophical text, Tao Te Ching, revealed the mystical truth of human life and provided extremely wise and precious guidance in regard to human living. However, as the content is so profound and the text so succinct that by nature this text has become as a pure “white light” and that all its individual readers throughout the past 2600 yrs. history could only perceive certain aspects of its reflected “seven colors,” meeting what is described in its text “Nature is like a bellows, Empty, yet never ceasing its supply when moving.” We hope, through mutual sharing of personal understanding of this text, group members of us all can be benefited in the growth of our personal spiritual pursuits as well as the improvement of our lives in terms of well-being and happiness.

results.description: Hmmm. This is an invitation to join me in gathering together like-minded women who've experienced life for a while :) and are in pursuit of similar interests as I. I am an ardent student of A Course In Miracles; Quantum Physics and especially a dedicated practice of the application of its principles; the pursuit of clear consciousness and lucidity; the practices of breathing (refer to Max Strom); the acquiring of wisdom (refer to Jesus, Buddha, Mohammed, Krishna, Sufi, Anais Nin, Steve Treu, Gary Zukav, Deepak Chopra to name a few); yoga (I'm very new to it but enthusiastic about its physical and spiritual rewards); the offering of compassion and kindness; and complete responsibility for self. This isn't a therapeutic nor venting outlet but rather a discovery and growth arena. I am forming this potential meetup because as I've progressed I am finding that most of my good old friends (whom I still and will always value) are not on the same page as I am and I'd like to connect with new friends who may be on the same page or at least reading the same book (metaphorically speaking). I live in the North Hills of Pittsburgh and am happy to travel southeast and north up to an hour for gatherings. At this point, I have not set a specific meeting time because my first step is finding women who are interested in such a pursuit. So if you are interested, please send me a note.
