results.description:
Welcome! This is a group dedicated to educational meet-ups in the South Hills of Pittsburgh, PA, learning to identify and sustainably utilize local plants for healing and for eating. I will be offering educational plant walks in the area and classes on how to make the most from local plants and "weeds." Many of these "weeds" are found in our own yards or nearby, and many of them have been found to help us heal a number of common ailments. You may be surprised what we find right in our.... neck of the woods!

I am also highly interested in sharing the value of the local natural areas with the community, as they are an invaluable part of our day-to-day life, even if we don't see or notice them regularly.  I plan to help conserve what areas I possibly can, as what we call "progress" continues to creep into our already very limited natural spaces, creating more light pollution and more traffic and wildlife problems more often than it should be.  But I need your help to do this.  I enjoy sharing these plant walks and classes and hope that the community, if not already awakened to the need to conserve this land, will awaken and see what is beneath our very feet, and that we need to protect it to truly survive.

Thank you for your interest in this group-- please contact me with any questions, ideas, or comments!

Green Blessings!
results.name: South Hills Wild Edible and Medicinal Plants Group

results.description:
Welcome to the Pittsburgh Chapter of the Product Development and Management Association (PDMA). We are a professional association dedicated to improving the effectiveness of individuals and organizations involved with product development, product management, and innovation. The Pittsburgh Chapter is committed to building product innovation knowledge in the Pittsburgh region by creating a vibrant community of practitioners, academics and service providers to share experiences.

Throughout the year, we sponsor educational and social events where you can develop new skills, learn best practices, and network with your peers. Join our Meetup group to find out about upcoming events! 


Our Mission

The Pittsburgh Chapter is dedicated to sharing knowledge and best practices through professional development, education, collaboration, and networking opportunities. We strive to build a vibrant community of practitioners, academics, and service providers that share experiences and knowledge of the principles, practices, and processes of effective product innovation.  Participation in this community will result in professional growth for individuals, an innovation related competitive advantage for their enterprises and the continued economic growth of the Western Pennsylvania Region.
results.name: PDMA Pittsburgh

The “Polish Pittsburgh Meet up” is for anyone who is interested in all things Polish. This group is being organized by the Polish Cultural Council of western Pennsylvania (PCC), a 200 plus member organization (polishculturalcouncil.org) whose sole mission is to bring to the audiences of western PA the best in contemporary Polish culture, whether it's film, art, language, lectures, cuisine and much, much more. 

We aim to share, explore, and join the conversations of modern Poland- addressing issues important and interesting in the context of Poland today. This meetup will serve as a platform for meetings with Poles, Polish Americans and those simply interested in Polish culture in a number of settings and formats. If you are interested in Polish history, genealogy, food, foreign policy, etc., we will be regularly hosting and creating events to share and learn about these topics . 

Interested in contemporary Polish music? Learning Polish? Film? Cuisine? Let’s meet up and start the conversation!

results.description:
Hello, After discovering that the Big Data Developers Group only allowed for IBM-sponsored events to be shared, I thought I'd start a new MeetUp group where anybody can post the events they're holding on topics relevant to the Big Data ecosystem. While I am a Cloudera employee, I welcome all interested parties to share events within the Pittsburgh Big Data community and post questions, comments, and jobs.

Obviously, to start, I will have more Cloudera meetups to post until people start submitting content. But, I will do my best to find and promote any related events and stay closely aligned with the Hadoop Users Group (HUG) and any other suggested groups.

Key interests right now within the ecosystem are the emergence of in-memory analytics like Spark, Storm, and Kafka; security best practices concerning kerberos, TLS, encryption, and database security (Apache Sentry); and what's next for Hadoop in this very fast-paced world.
results.name: Pittsburgh Big Data Meetups

results.description:
Welcome to the Sports Monster Pittsburgh Softball Meetup!

This group is for anyone and everyone who wants to play softball with a great, friendly group of people. We welcome everyone from total beginners to very advanced, and everyone gets to play with people of their own skill level.

It is our mission to get as many people playing softball in Pittsburgh as possible. So whether you are an old pro, or have never picked up a bat before - we are the place for you. Come along and check us out!

What can I expect to find here?

Well run programming. You want to have fun but also play in something that is well run
Seasonal leagues and one day tournaments. Special outings/events from time to time.

Great value to play in seasonal leagues complete with rosters, team photos, schedules, standings, and even articles about games.

A club atmosphere where you can play tons of softball, meet tons of new friends and have a great time
We look forward to meeting you and playing some of the most fun softball Pittsburgh has to offer. 

If you have any questions, ideas or just want to get involved, please contact paula@sportsmonster.net - I'd love to talk to you!
results.name: Sports Monster Pittsburgh Softball Meetup

results.description:
Calling all small breed dog owners! This group is dedicated to creating social events for our small pups to enjoy. From meeting at dog parks to taking an adventurous walk at Frick Park, sign up your pup for an active social life. The group meets within the city of Pittsburgh and includes dogs 20 lbs. and under. All happy pups that get along with both other dogs and people are welcome! 

•  Pups must be leashed to and from events.

•  Pup Parents must have control over their pups at all times.

•  Please bring water for your pup. Water is not always provided and is served community-style when it is.

•  Pup Parents are responsible for cleaning up after their pup. Please bring your own doggie bags.

•  Pups must not be aggressive to others and must be people and other dog friendly.

•  All pups must be licensed and up to date on their vaccinations. 

•  Please leave dogs in heat at home.

•  This group is designed for small breed dogs, weighing under 20 lbs. full grown.

•  Socialization at your own risk!

•  Sign-in at events is sometimes required to ensure rules are understood for you and your pups safety!
results.name: Pittsburgh Small Breed Dogs Meetup

This is a group for anyone who wants to learn about and/or practice vedanta; anyone who enjoys satsang; anyone who want to read and discuss the Bhagavad Gita; anyone interested in meditation; and anyone who is seeker on the religious/spiritual path. This group was started to raise awareness about vedanta and reach out to everyone including those simply curious about it to those practicing it. For those who do not know what vedanta is about, here is a quote to get you started: "Each soul is potentially divine. The goal is to manifest this divinity within by controlling nature, external and internal. Do this either by work or worship or psychic control or philosophy, by one or more or all of these – and be free. This is the whole of religion. Doctrines or dogmas, rituals or books, temples or forms, are but secondary details." - Swami Vivekananda.

For more information visit http://vedanta-pitt.org/.

Perfecting your communication and leadership skill offers you a greater chance of promotion, better pay, access to social networking opportunities and being respected by others.

A CALL TO ACTION:
Think of the worst career that you would never want to do for a living, then ask yourself, "What one life skill is holding this person back (who has this job) from attaining a more rewarding career". The answer to this question is ALWAYS; Better communication skills!

topics.name: Physical and Emotional Balance with Essential Oil

results.description:
Hello! Welcome to the South Hills Young Living Essential Oils Meetup Group. Here you will meet other people interested in alternative health and naturopathic healing via therapeutic grade essential oils. 

Young Living Essential Oils are the industry leaders in essential oils. In fact, they are the industry standard oils with massage therapists and in many alternative healing practices. They are the only oils allowed to be used in Raindrop Technique, an emerging therapy. See below for more information. They are also used in hospitals throughout the U.S. They are even used intravenously in the Nova Vita clinic in Ecuador. They are very different than food-grade and perfume-grade essential oils (EOs) sold in many health food stores. Most health food store essential oils and other "knock off" companies are either synthetic, a few molecules are changed, cut with alcohol and other ingredients or are distilled quickly at high temperatures for fast, mass production, hence making the oils more affordably appealing, yet with no healing properties. 

Young Living Essential Oils are true therapeutic-grade EOs. In fact, Gary Young coined the term therapeutic-grade for essential oils. They are the purest grade EOs on the market. An additional note, oils for healing, cleansing and masach (hebrew word for anoint, which means to smear, spread or massage) are mentioned more than 250 times in the bible. results.description: Stay up to date on events and other activities at Revv Oakland, a member-driven coworking community in the heart of Pittsburgh, just steps away from Pitt and CMU. Revv's 20,000 square feet of affordable and flexible office space are home to dozens of alumni powered startups, university spin outs and other aspiring entrepreneurs. Our facilities also serve as a community gathering spot. In cooperation with over 20 event partners, Revv has to date hosted more than 2000 attendees across 70 events. We have a great lineup planned for the remainder of 2015 and beyond. Join our group in order to RSVP and receive updates on upcoming events!

results.description:
We are a group who enjoys fine dining experiences all around the Pittsburgh region. Pittsburgh is getting a reputation as a great food experience town. Let's explore all these wonderful restaurants that are in our own back yard.

To be fair to all, I want to make everyone aware of the expectations within this group.

First of all, we do have a RSVP attendance policy.  Please read and understand this policy as it will be enforced.  This policy can be found under discussions at this link: http://www.meetup.com/Pittsburgh-Fine-Dining-Meetup/messages/boards/thread/48846086 

Secondly, I will be selecting upscale, higher end restaurants most of the time.  I would request that you dress appropriately.  For most restaurants, business casual attire would be appropriate.  However, some restaurants may have other requirements or suggestions such as suit jackets and ties for men.  I suggest you visit the restaurants web site to understand what type of establishment it is.

The dining groups will be limited to six to eight people per event.  This is so that we can all talk with each other and enjoy the dining experience.

I look forward to sharing some lovely dinners with you.
results.name: Pittsburgh Fine Dining

topics.name: Meeting New People that Share the Same Interest

results.description: Have you ever been in public and seen someone reading a book you've read and wish you were one of those people who could just sit down and start talking to them about it, but realize that even if you were you wouldn't ever be so rude as to disrupt someone engrossed in what you know to be a great book? Or have you been at the gym and out of the corner of your eye, noticed that the person on the treadmill next to you has your favorite song on their workout playlist? Have you found yourself scrolling through all the Meetup events desperately wanting to find one to attend, but don't feel like drinking or dancing, or mingling with a bunch of single 21 year olds? Does your perfect night consist of reading/Netflixing at home quietly where you can watch season three of Parks and Recreation for the third time without judgement? If the idea of going alone to meet a bunch of bubbly strangers at a public space where you have to come up with a note card sized description of who you are and what you do freaks you out, THANK GOD. Leave the Extroverts to their raucous laughter and innate sense of belonging, while we drink coffee and wine and have conversations about the importance of Treat Yo' Self day. Or maybe go to lunch and enjoy someone else's company while we read separately together. Or maybe go to one of those weird wine painting classes you've secretly been wanting to go to, but could never find anyone to go with so you never did. No? Just me? This is a group for introverts that want to experience friendship in the comfort of like-minded individuals.
results.name: Introverts of Pittsburgh

results.description:
The Art of War Leadership and Communications (L/C) Community

A place to go where liked minded people can discuss ideas in business and self improvement.

Whether you are new to leadership or an experience veteran this community is self sustained by the sharing of advice and personal experiences.

The Purpose of AOWL

To learn from each other. What books, audio or courses have you used to improve your L/C skills?

Let's build strong strategic relationships with each other and learn skills in L/C to make us more productive.

What Members Can Expect

An atmosphere of sharing and interacting ideas. Members can volunteer to present an interactive game on communicating or share a Business book review. Any ideas that will get the group excited about being apart of the community and learning valuable skills.

Who Should Join

If you are serious about your personal and career growth. If you have a need to improve in L/C skills.

If you been a Leader in the past and want to Mentor others, this is the group for you.
results.name: The Art of War Leadership

results.description:
This is a group for those people who like to walk outside at a leisurely pace (no, not Old Man pace but not crazy exercise addict pace either....); who like to walk/hike for 60-90 min, maybe the occasional 2 hours; who don't want to hike so long or far you have to carry a backpack; who like to sleep in; who want to meet in Pittsburgh proper. Though I don't require anyone to be a certain age, I envision this group will mostly be comprised of people in their 30's and 40's. The goal of each hike will be to finish in the allotted time frame, not cover a specific distance - we all have lives and want to know what time we can expect to be done, within reason. If pressed for a fitness level, I would recommend you be moderately fit and stable (eg, not need help balancing). Though we are primarily a walking/hiking group, there may be other community events like movies, dinners, games, etc. 

Things that will not be tolerated: No shows or same day cancellations. Just don't do it. It's annoying for both the organizers and the members and you will be removed from the group if it happens. The goal of the group is to actually make friends you plan to hang out with outside of meetup events, and no one wants friends who bail out.
results.name: The Not Too Intense Hiking Group in Pittsburgh

results.description: Beat Cancer Boot Camp (BCBC) is a unique exercise and social support program designed to empower and inspire people to take control of their own lives through exercise and group socialization. Beat Cancer Boot Camp (BCBC) is designed to condition your body and mind for healing. The classes will include a variety of exercises designed to be effective and challenging. Workouts are geared toward all fitness levels as you move through various stages of cancer treatment and recovery. BCBC is a Nationally Recognized Fitness and Support Based Support Program. The program is designed to empower and inspire cancer survivors, spouses, family members, friends and anyone else who wants to join the battle against cancer and take charge of their lives! BCBC was developed to help motivate all who have been touched by cancer to stay active during cancer, treatment and beyond. BCBC creates very strong support groups where cancer survivors and their loved ones can come together to reclaim their lives with exercise and a shared appreciation for one another. Haven’t exercised for a while? Getting older or have some health limitations? In great shape and want to keep that way? No problem! This BCBC is for you! YOU didn’t sign up for CANCER.YOU never expected to FIGHT this BATTLE.DON’T FIGHT IT ALONE. Beat Cancer Boot Camp is more than just an exercise program. It’s also a social support group. www.beatcancerbootcamp.com

results.description:
Buddhist Forum
Humans tend to seek truth in life. Thus science has advanced and civilization has been enhanced. The truth of life as such and its function (living) should be said the highest and most mysterious subject in this regard. Throughout the human history, many different sources, scientific as well as religious, have all continuously studied from different aspects in order to unveil the truth of such a mystery. However, among them, only what the teachings of Buddha Sakiamuni (Gautama, Siddartha) revealed some 2500 years ago can be said to possess the most rational conviction and to be the most objectively promising. The makeup of human life and its living sustain and continue by means of the law of karmic cause and effect, which may also perfectly explain the reincarnation of a person. Not until the understanding of such mechanism of the process of life should any ultimate Truth, such as Voidness, Love, God, all are One, etc., be substantially meaningful.
    Our Meetup will have two parts. One is to study the fundamental doctrines of Buddhism, the other is for the discussion or sharing of any Buddhist concepts from the comparative-religious point of view. We hope through attending the meeting everybody will get strongly inspired to know to conduct a more meaningful and valuable life.
results.name: Sewickley Buddhist-Forum Meetup

results.description:
FIND YOUR JOY with ATS! This form of Bellydance gives a woman a unique sense of power and beauty and teaches them how to work in harmony with each other. Bonding with women and learning the art and language of this amazing dance form is inspiring to women of all ages , sizes and abilities. Seeing an army of women on stage in full power and glory, flowing together without choreography, so graceful and strong. The friendships help us bond in a community and give you a sense of sisterhood that is much needed in todays society. If you have ever done other tribal styles or fusion dances, chances are, you are using some of our moves already, because they are incorporated into many dance forms. Come and try a class! We welcome you to join us. Beginner classes every Monday at 6:00 … Level Two Classes are Monday at 7:00 (level one vocabulary and basics are prerequisite) Drop ins welcome $15.00 class Prepaid Ten lessons for just 100.00.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-xCqe_Zl5MA&feature=youtu.be

results.description: HackPittsburgh is a non-profit, community-based workshop that allows members to come together and share skills and tools to pursue creative projects. Our membership is open to everyone but typically comprises inventors, engineers, scientists, programmers, hobbyists, artists, roboteers, families, entrepreneurs, and arts and crafts enthusiasts. Our focus is on collaboration, education, and community outreach. We’re a benevolent group and do not promote or condone illegal activities. The term “hacking” is used in a benign sense, in the context of deconstructing and understanding objects and systems and re-purposing existing materials for new and innovative uses. We have events every Friday night (except for holidays), open to the public, and usually free, where people can come in for interesting talks or presentations and see the shop and what we have to offer. Details on any particular Friday night event are posted to the blog on our main page somewhere between a few days and a week prior to the event. We host several outside groups who meet in our space and whose events are also open to the public. Please visit http://www.hackpittsburgh.org for more information.
results.name: HackPittsburgh

results.description:
This group is for anyone who is or wants to be an entrepreneur and start or run a business. Whether you are a part-time “one-man band” or have been in business for 30 years with hundreds of employees, we all have something to share about struggles of starting a business, keeping revenue flowing and delivering new products to market. You could be just at the “idea” phase, have a product, be in production or successful with many customers. All entrepreneurs struggle with curve balls daily and this meetup is a space where you can talk through ideas and questions you may have while offering your own personal insights and experiences to each other.

We typically meet once a week in the East Liberty neighborhood of Pittsburgh and adjourn to an appropriate local venue within walking distance based on the turnout, time commitments and weather. For those wanting to check-in before the meeting, we have a conference call Sunday night to let you work on ideas before our meetup Monday morning.
results.name: BizzBuzzBang Entrepreneur Network

results.description: If you are 18 or older and looking to get together with other writers and would-be writers, join Marianne Reid Anderson, executive editor of Northern Connection and Pittsburgh’s FiftyFive Plus magazines and Freelance Writer Amanda King to discuss, learn or share the ins and outs, do’s and don’ts, getting started and getting published. We will include tips and techniques, ways to get the words flowing, writing for different genres and media including print, online, social media, blogging, editorial etiquette and so much more…

results.description: This casual, a cappella singing group is primarily a way for experienced choristers to maintain their skills and to grow as musicians in a community of new friends. An ad-hoc vocal experience, Summer Sing is not intended as a performing group, but as a fun, weekly practice session until traditional choirs resume a regular rehearsal schedule. • Sing folk songs, canons, hymns, part-songs, madrigals • Vocal improvisation will draw on collective creativity and individual flexibility • Ear training and vocalizing with an emphasis on resonance and legato We will sing outside at the Second United Presbyterian Church of Wilkinsburg – the church adjoins a beautiful little neighborhood park with a sunny garden and big old shade trees. The church also hosts a free-play session in the park for kids and families each Thursday, which makes for a nice "child-care by committee" environment – with free snow cones! Ample, free street parking is also available. Key inspiration for this project comes from the teachings of Alice Parker and Ysaye Barnwell; aspirations from the recordings of Bobby McFerrin.
results.name: Summer Sing Pittsburgh: a cappella in the park

If there are any members who would like to post and host an event, please let me know and I will add you as an organizer. Let’s do this together!
The intent of this group is to bring like-minded Christians together for fun, food, and fellowship. 2 Corinthians 6:14 King James Version
14 Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?
“ It doesn’t say relationships, it doesn’t say marriage but its implication is that of any relationship with another person.” STEVEN JAMES DIXON

results.description:
Bagels & Bytes is technology-related peer learning and networking at its best! We are the local 501 Tech Club and Net2 affiliate group in the City of Pittsburgh.

Bring your tech questions, ideas, and issues. Join our fellowship of nonprofit techies (professional and "accidental" are equally welcome) as we brainstorm, share ideas and solutions, and support each other! This group is very supportive and non-judgmental. There is no such thing as a "stupid" question at these meetings — all questions and topics for discussion are welcomed. We learn from each other in unexpected ways constantly, regardless of knowledge or skill levels. Hence, you don't have to be an "expert" techie to attend, just curious and interested in nonprofit technology.

This group meets the first Wednesday of each month (except January and July) from 8:30-10 am. Meeting locations rotate every few months, but the group is always hosted by a local nonprofit org. We typically do a summer "outing" each June (2015 will be Bagels & Bytes & Critters at Animal Rescue League on June 3). We generally hold our December meeting on a Friday afternoon at Dave and Buster's at the Waterfront, our annual "holiday party."

Bagels & Bytes is FREE to attend, but you must RSVP. Please register via phone or email at 412-397-6000 or bcnm@rmu.edu. You may also register online at http://www.rmu.edu/bcnmregistration.

Learn more about upcoming events on our blog: https://bagelsbytesallegheny.wordpress.com/.

Started: 2000

Current organizer: Cindy Leonard
results.name: Bagels & Bytes

results.description: July 12, 2015 Enjoy a day cycling along the Great Allegheny Passage Rails to Trail between West Newton and Pittsburgh’s South Side in support of the American Red Cross. The American Red Cross Ride for the Red Steel Towns Trail Ride is a daylong cycling trip between West Newton and Pittsburgh. Riders can start at either end of the route - in historic West Newton or in Pittsburgh’s Southside - and return to their starting location. Riders can choose their own pace and any distance up to the 64 mile full course. Register today at : crowdrise.com/ridethesteeltowntrail For more info place this link in your browser: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/32941424/Ride%20for%20Red%20Flyer%20download.pdf The Steel Towns Trail Ride along the GAP Trail route will allow riders to enjoy the trail alongside the Youghiogheny and Monongahela Rivers, from West Newton through the historic steel towns of Boston, McKeesport, Duquesne, Homestead, The Waterfront and Pittsburgh’s Southside. The trail, recently completed to Pittsburgh, has a packed, crushed limestone surface for a smooth ride. Built mainly on abandoned rail beds, the trail is nearly level with the average grade of less than 1 percent. The ride between West Newton and Pittsburgh follows the Youghiogheny and Monongahela Rivers and travels through many historic local and reclaimed “Steel City” areas. Along the ride you will enjoy the rivers, historic industrial sights, parks, bike-only river bridges and other interesting cycling sights to make the day enjoyable and interesting while supporting the mission of American Red Cross. Riders are asked to solicit donations in support of the Red Cross totaling a minimum of $250 to participate. All proceeds from this ride will be donated to American Red Cross Disaster Relief and Military Family Support Services, and will help your neighbors in times of greatest need. All donors will receive a receipt from the ARC for charitable contribution records. Register today at crowdrise.com/ridethesteeltowntrail
results.name: American Red Cross Ride for the Red - Steel Town Trail Ride

results.description:
I'm probably not moving to London or the Bay Area. Is it possible to be a professional Haskell programmer in Pittsburgh? Wouldn't it be nice to have a day job slinging Erlang or Elixir?. How about getting paid to hack Clojure? Maybe your dream job is coding Common Lisp or OCaml. Is there anything we can do to promote functional programming in our town? Can we be a little less passive? If there was a visible functional community in the area, could that help to create possibilities?

With the possible exception of the multi-paradigm language Scala, I'm not sure there is a single functional programming language that's in wide enough commercial use here in Pittsburgh to support a significant work force. Likewise, potential employers might be averse to adopting FP for lack of a pool  of such developers from which to draw. But perhaps all functional languages taken together as a whole could provide a suitable foundation. It's a concurrent and polyglot world now and our industry needs what the functional paradigm has to offer.

The hope is that such a community could lower the barriers to adoption of functional languages for both employers and developers in our area.
results.name: Pittsburgh Functional Programming Meetup

results.description:
There are SO many good books out there just waiting to be read! From classic literature to new releases, from chick lit to sci-fi, from paranormal romance to parody, I want to get my hands on as many good books as I can find. If you're like me and you want a chance to discuss the books you just never got around to reading (I still haven't read all of The Hunger Games trilogy...) or if you're gushing to talk about the latest hit novel, this is the group for you. 

I also enjoy trying new foods (modest way of saying, "I love to eat!") as much as I love to read! My goal is to include a snack or meal at every meetup, whether that means having a quiet brunch in a member's home or meeting up at a cafe or restaurant. And though the group name is "Books & Brunch," we'll likely have a variety of meeting times (morning, afternoon, and evening) to accommodate everyone's schedules. 

I look forward to meeting you and hearing your book picks!

results.description:
One the most tragic things that I can imagine is for two people who might make a wonderful couple never get started because they were too afraid to say hello. This is not just another singles group. There are plenty of them on meetup that do a lot of fun activities. This group is aimed specifically at those who might need some guidance in the world of dating. We are not just going to post activities and hope people talk to each other. We will actively try and match people with others by age, interests and relationship goals. Please bear with me as we learn together how this will work. Membership will be closed once we reach a certain number while we work out the kinks. If you joined during this test period, your membership will remain free as long as you are a member. The rules:

-You participate in this group at your own risk. Members of this group are not screened in any way. The organizers of this group and Meetup.com cannot be held responsible for anything negative that may happen to you as a result of this group.

-Single means single. Do not waste other members time by posing as single while you have a significant other. If someone in your life would be upset that you are a member of this group, do not join!

-3 no shows to events and you are out of the group. 

 -Be respectful. Ask yourself: would a jerk do or say this? If the answer is yes, do not say or do that thing.

 -Rejection sucks. It is painful and at times it can feel like the end of the world. It’s not. Handle it the best you can and understand that there are others out there. 

 -If you find someone that you are going to date exclusively either through this group or another, please remove yourself from the group. You are welcome to rejoin if things do not work out. 

 -Answer any questions that may be required for membership honestly. 

 -Report any violations of these rules to the organizers of this group. Those found to be in violation of the rules will be banned immediately. 

 Thanks and have fun!
results.name: Shy singles

results.description:
I need to get out of the house! I'm divorced, sober, and single, and 34. Are there other people like me in Washington, PA? Let's meet up. I'm starting my life over and looking to get out and meet some new people and do some new things. It's time for something different.

I created the group for sober people, but at the same time this is not AA. I am myself a recovering alcoholic and understand the triggers and difficulties that come along with it, but we may have some Meetups at restaurants that serve drinks. I don't find it to be a problem if someone has a drink with their dinner. It does not bother me. The intent of the group is to get people out and social without meeting at the bar and drinking all night or meeting with a keg on the weekends. If there are people that may be triggered by being in a casual dining setting with alcohol let me know, and I will definitely plan some events where there is strictly no alcohol as well. I don't want to exclude anyone.

Everyone in the group is now an Event Organizer. What does that mean? That means if anybody in the group has an idea they would like to plan they are free to schedule a Meetup. This may help add variety to the group. Have an idea? Post it. But all events shall be drug & alcohol free, or at least keep the alcohol to a minimum and note that there may be alcohol in case some of the members may have triggers they are watching out for.
results.name: Sober and Single in Washington PA

results.description:
For the suffering, lonely, conscious or unconscious. Those who wish for solutions and actual support. To decondition and reprogram together.  We all have ideas of solutions to see actual change.  FETS offers a place for us all to heal and 'work' together in a new structure that we've been craving, offering guidance towards individual and collective self awarness. 

FETS support group offers specific information in a tangible way that guides us to activate our light bodies together.  Through tangible and necessary life applications that will help promote a less stressful lifestyle and environment.  During the metopes, we'll be providing information through group and personal guidance along with a personalized 'Book of Illumination' that will help each person on their journey through self awareness.  See more details about the life book on our website fromegotospirit.weebly.com.  FETS meetups also offer structure that explains the different lifestyle choices that we've made, consciously and unconsciously, that have created the patterns and habits that either help or keep us stuck in patterns that don't allow us to evolve at a rate that reduces suffering.  Along with the Life Book, each person has the opportunity to receive their personal Human Design chart that allows them to discover a strategy that is specific to them that gives them a 'road map' or 'gps' to follow to notice less stress and see more results through synchronicity and at the same time allows them to relax into a flow that is authentic to their ascension process.  

Hello Dear Reader, if you have found our meetup and are here reading this that means that you are waking up and beginning to see and feel that the life that you have been living isn’t really your life and the world that you have been told is real, ever since you were a little child, isn’t really how the world is supposed to be. Something inside you is waking up like a volcano that has been sleeping for thousands of years and you didn’t even know that it was there.  It’s creating shifts within you, in your perspective of the environment around you, your life style, your values, your choices, your relationships and the all the roles of your life on this planet at this time. You are searching for something or someone to help you understand what is going on and what to do with it. Or you have been riding this vibration for a while now and you are looking for help to get on the next level, or you are just stuck in pain and misery and you don’t know what you can do to get out of it. Ether way you have come to the right place and we are happy that you are here!

What is happening is the SPIRITUAL AWAKENING. There is a huge wave of SPIRITUAL AWAKENING  all over our planet that has been going on for some time now. Different people from different parts of the world are opening their eyes for the first time. They feel and see that there is something wrong with the world that we are told is real and this “reality” that dictates the laws and the rules of our lives. This process of SPIRITUAL AWAKENING is very unique and very powerful and because of it happening now, we are able to go through a transformation and become who we are designed to be and create the world for us, our children and all of the future generations. A world that is completely different from the one that we have been living in. There are a lot of different factors and a lot of different levels of truth of why we have aloud everything to come to this. Right now, with the way the society is and what it’s telling us is moral and normal, it’s literally turning us in to animals,  monkeys.(We’ll get in to this deeper) The time has come for all of us, all of the people in this world to wake up, come together and create  necessary changes and see solutions!  As of now the situation is simple and yet critical because people who will wake up in time will make it through the shift and be a part of the new world and the new reality.

The reason why we are creating this meetup is to give access to the necessary information for the ones that are ready to wake up and the ones who are already going through this process. There is so much information out there right now about the SPIRITUAL AWAKENING and unfortunately a lot of that information is misleading and misguiding because of which a lot of good people are being tricked in to deviating from their path and focus on things that are actually meant to prevent them from waking up. Our intention is to create a place that anyone who is in search, anyone who is stuck, anyone that has any questions can come to and find exactly what they need in that moment to keep evolving spiritually. Get clarity and step-by-step instructions on what to do in every situation when they are stuck. We have been going through the SPIRITUAL AWAKENING process for a very long time now. We have the personal experience and we’ve put in the foot work of going through this process ourselves so we can guide who is in need and lost, this is a part of our life's mission, to do what we do and give to the people what we know. Always remember KNOWLEDGE IS POWER. The information that we have has empowered us and that is why it is important that we share this with the world and to experience the shared information that a lot already feel themselves.  

This process of SPIRITUAL AWAKENING is a very powerful process and very difficult to go though on many different levels and there are a lot and I mean a lot of levels in this process. Some are easier then the others and some are very difficult and painful.  They create unnecessary suffering with out the proper support systems that we’re lacking in our societies.  We will brake down every level and all the factors as we see and understand them in order for you to have a clearer view and understanding of what’s happening and what to do about it. We are working on preparing all of the material that we have so far, in organized step-by-step instructions on the lay out of the whole thing.  We will also give you the guidance from many other spiritual teachers and the information that they have, to make this process as quick as possible for you. The important things to understand is the fact that we can not do this for you, you are the ones that have to do the work on yourselves in order to be successful in the transformation. You will have access to all of the information you’ll need to make this work for you, we are showing you the doors you are the ones that will have to go through them.

There are certain steps that you have to take and certain things that you have to do to put yourself on the vibration that will allow you to begin your spiritual journey. First step that you have to take is very important and it is taking care of your body. It might sound simple at first but there are many factors that come in to play when it comes to actually taking care of your body. The very first important things is to know and understand how the condition and the environment of your physical body effects you and your ability to evolve on all levels. There are so many factors in your environment that you are not aware of and how they directly effect your way of thinking, your way of seeing, your way of believing, your ability to understand and process information and your way of being. 

This support group will look at many factors, including this one, and we’ll be hitting them all together!

Supportive Tools:

Each of us will receive a personalized 'Life Book' - areas in our life that need to be looked at and cleaned up to activate our DNA

Activation Kits - helps to reduce stress so you can manifest and see results through synchronistic experiences more often - helps to produce a place of balance with in & with out

results.description:
All of us have a Dream Source within ourselves ready to provide us with timely news and information about our health, our careers, our relationships, the state of our psyche and possible futures before us. By claiming the energy of our dreams, working with the dreams and sharing them with other dreamers in a safe and encouraging space we can make great changes in our lives and find a source of creativity, fun and adventure within ourselves.

The foundation of becoming an awakened dreamer is dream journaling. We'll present basic journaling techniques and how to encourage our Dream Source to send us more dreams. One we have dreams to work with we can share them with others in a safe way that encourages us to take the positive energy of our dreams to make changes in our waking life. We will also cover using dreams as a source of creativity and problem solving, as a path to our own inner spiritual guides and as a fun place for exploration and adventure.

Once we become dreamers who are capturing and working with our dreams we can begin the real adventure. We are not limited to worldly concerns in dreaming and can use our dreams in near-infinite ways to expand our horizons and abilities and to have fun. We can use our dreams as the basis for creative works using the images directly or as the source for writing. We can play in our dream by dialoging with dream characters or performing dream theater in a group, or by reentering our dreams to get more information. The adventures you can have with dreaming are limitless and are only bounded by your imagination. Dreaming is an adventure, dreaming is fun, and dreaming is about soul. Join a group of fellow adventures who desire to dig into these ancient depths!

results.description:
Getting married soon, or know someone else who is? Element Church has partnered with TwoGether Pittsburgh (twogetherpgh.org) to offer marriage prep classes. The cost is FREE! Includes continental breakfast, lunch and an online relationship assessment worth $50. Also, every couple that attends receives a $100 gift certificate to Henne Jewlers towards their wedding rings! The class is being offered on Saturday, August 1, and it runs from 9 AM to 3 PM. Sign up at the Element Church website (www.TheElementChurch.com) FAQ
* "Are these religious classes?" - While this class is offered in a Christian church, it is not a religious class at all. There are no Bible verses quoted, no offering or donation solicited, etc. * "Is it BORING??" - We don't think so! We utilize video, group discussion, and lots of interaction between you and your future spouse to drive the classes. We actually think our process is quite engaging! It is a chunk of time to invest, but isn't a relationship you plan on having for your lifetime worth investing at least a few hours of prep time? * "What if we are planning on getting married, but we haven't set a date yet? Can we still come?" - YES! We think that investing in growing your relationship is a great idea, no matter what stage you are in. * "How is this all FREE??" - The class is provided by a Federal grant. All of the class materials, food, etc. is covered in the grant. The only thing they require is some basic paperwork to be filled out at the class. OTHER QUESTIONS??? Feel free to reply to this post or directly send me an email: rich@theelementchurch.com
results.name: Pittsburgh Marriage Meetup

We host a variety of themed singles events ranging from large scale singles parties and mixers to smaller group activities such as wine tasting and movie nights. Our all-star management team has over 30 years of combined experience in the singles industry and over the years they have hosted hundreds of successful singles events. They have a proven track record of their events leading to countless relationships, engagements, and even marriages.

results.description:
Men (especially those between 25-35) interested in a two-month self-develop "bootcamp" style group course focused on discovering who you truly are, what you really want, and learning a structured approach for pursuing and achieving what is most important to you. This is a high pace, interactive course. It is ideal for those ready to move into action now. There will be a strong social element as well, as participants will work together to form a tight-knit team that fosters individual success and encouragement.

<br>Program Format & Cost: <br>- Tentative start date: Wed., September 2nd at 7pm with weekly sessions to follow (8 in total) <br>- Meet in a private & confidential setting at the Paramount Film Exchange, one of the newest coworking spaces in Pittsburgh (near Mercy Hospital) <br>- Cost is $129/participant and is 100% refundable within the first month <br>- No payment due until the end of the first session so you can come and make sure it's the right fit for you

<br>Examples of Common Problems We'll Address: <br>- Having a clear idea or vision but don't know how to actually make it happen <br>- Feeling like you have a massive amount of potential to contribute to the world but don't know how to channel it best <br>- Wanting to do so much more in life but you're not really sure what you're after <br>- Feeling like it's too late or too hard to actually live the life you want to live

<br>We will confront all of these issues and more by utilizing tools, approaches, and frameworks proven to help you develop inner strength and move forward. Much of this course will be based off the best practices in emergency response today; one of this most demanding and results-oriented fields in existence. This is NOT a "fluffy" or "woo woo" course. We will dig deep and focus on things that actually work. So if you're ready to go within yourself, shed the status quo and take action, join us!

results.description:
Shut Up & Write! Meetup is a venue for writers to work in the company of other writers on a regular basis. Writing, whether approached as a profession or as an avocation, is an isolating activity. We provide this forum, writing resources and meeting times as a method of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about ‘writing down the bones’ and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

Meetup Format
Making the time to write one hour per week is an empowering and ultimately rewarding experience but it needs to serve as the foundation of your daily discipline. If you RSVP that you are coming, then please arrive 10-15 minutes before the start of the Meetup. The facilitator will lead introductions and then the group will write for an hour. There will then be 15-30 minutes of social time to get to know each other and possibly discuss personal writing successes such as getting published or overcoming writing resistance in some small way. No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Writing is the only thing that, when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.
Gloria Steinem
results.name: Shut Up & Write! Pittsburgh

results.description: This is an IBM sponsored PaaS meetup group. Geared towards developers, architects and all Cloud Foundry and Bluemix enthusiasts, we learn about Bluemix hands on with fellow developers. Learn how to use this PaaS product with the current apps. Our meetups are free.
results.name: Bluemix - Pittsburgh PaaS and Cloud Computing Meetup

results.description:
Are you a mom with a career and finding it difficult to meet other moms? Tired of missing out on all of the daytime play groups and the opportunity to meet other similar moms? I am starting this group because, as a mom with a full time job/career, I feel like I miss out on a vital part of the parenting experience! And, since this is 2015, I refuse to believe that a woman cannot have a career AND be an amazing mom. I know that I am not alone. I'm just looking to create 'stay-at-home mom' opportunities for working moms in Pittsburgh. I hope that, if you are reading this, you understand where I am coming from and decide to join!

PS. Play dates after 5pm ARE possible! Lol
results.name: Working Mothers

results.description: This group is for men who have gone through, continue to battle, and may be considering divorce. Specifically, looking for such men with children torn in the middle. While may support groups are out there for women, men too need someone to console and talk to about this very difficult moment in their lives. The format is always constructive, truthful and positive.
results.name: The Pittsburgh Divorcing Man's Support Group

results.description: Learn investing from a local expert with 19 years experience. Hands on examples, analysis, and start to finish projects.
results.name: Alex Deacon Team Real Estate Networking Meetup
